passages.name: give yourself over to it
passages.text: Ragged howls burst from your lungs. A flock of birds startles into flight. Everything will startle from you after this. Maybe it should. The tears come hot and quick and fierce.\n\n[[look down]]

passages.name: ask what happens when it doesn't
passages.text:
She sighs. "It depends on the monster."

[[agree willingly]]
[[agree reluctantly]]
[[refuse|Walk away 2]]

passages.name: protest
passages.text:
"You made a bargain with a witch. I never said it would be fair."

You know the stories about witches well enough. It's why you came here. Your hands are tied.

<<timedgoto "accept" 6s>>

passages.name: okay 2
passages.text:
You find yourself lingering in Yasmeen's kitchen, sipping awkwardly at a drink you don't really want. 

You catch yourself looking over your shoulder reflexively for a flash of white, or a glimpse of dark hair. You don't see <<print $ghostgender1>> again the rest of the evening. 

Still, you make an effort: you hover at the edges of conversations, try to drop in an offhand remark during a lull every once in a while, but no one rises to the bait. 

[[as always]]

passages.name: one
passages.text: You've carried it so long.<<set $confession3 to prompt("Write it down:"," ")>>\n\nNo more paper. Nothing more to confess. You clutch the small dead scraps in your hand and look to the [[tree|fire]].

passages.name: walk away
passages.text: You don't have the patience for this. It's already gnawing at you, blurring your resistance to a soft haze. As much as you might want to sink your teeth into their supple neck, tear that fragile vein until it gouts hot blood over your face and theirs, close at last -\n\nNo. You push past him, the feel of his body against yours only making the hunger clamor louder. The dance floor is a potential slaughter. You [[break]] for the freedom of the alley -

passages.name: break 2
passages.text: You come back to the clearing. Your mouth is still full of blood.\n\n[[spit]]

passages.name: kindness strength
passages.text:
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: away mother
passages.text: Her voice //has// gotten more <<if $mother eq "concerned">>worried<<else if $mother eq "frustrated">>upset<<else if $mother eq "indifferent">>removed<<endif>> lately. You haven't known what to say to fix it, so you've been [[silent|mother memory]].

passages.name: come and see
passages.text:
You approach the stream, bend your face towards the pool. The trails of light on your hands cast whorls into the water, forming patterns that blossom and dissipate in moments. One stirs a pang of recognition.

[[a pair of - fangs?]] They glint sharp in the light.
[[a hand?]] Its fingers have crumbled and rotted.
[[the slightest sheen]] So insubstantial it might not have been there.

passages.name: Look harder
passages.text: A <<cyclinglink "young" "middle aged" "weary">> face. <<cyclinglink "Tired" "Dark" "Weary" "Red-rimmed">> eyes. Every familiar line and blemish and mistake, there for you to see. But then - \n\nSomething [[shines]] through your skin, a faint glow.

passages.name: she looks at you
passages.text:
"You can come back and tend the clearing, if you like, Makes no difference to me. But maybe it will to you."

[[Yes.]] You have to try.
[[Yes.|Yes. 2]] You owe them that much.
[[No.]] You can't bear it.
[[No.|No. 2]] It isn't your responsibility.

passages.name: laugh along
passages.text: Your laugh sounds harsh and false to your own ears, rusty from disuse. No one seems to notice anything's off. You wish they would. Anything.\n\nNothing. [[As always|wait for a different opening]].

passages.name: yeah right
passages.text: You've lived too long to hope. <<timedgoto "zombiepool" 4s >>

passages.name: focus
passages.text: She waves her hand impatiently. "They won't be lost if you take your eyes from the light, you know. You'll see them everywhere now you've broken through. Besides, you can't stay here much longer." Her look is sharp. It's an order.\n\n[[ok|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: savage friend gender
passages.text: <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They stood by you after the disappearance, when the rest of your circle cast suspicious looks at you at parties, stopped inviting you to drinks. They insisted they'd been the last to see your missing friend, that they were sure of your innocence.<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He stood by you after the disappearance, when the rest of your circle cast suspicious looks at you at parties, stopped inviting you to drinks. He insisted he'd been the last to see your missing friend, that he was sure of your innocence.<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She stood by you after the disappearance, when the rest of your circle cast suspicious looks at you at parties, stopped inviting you to drinks. She insisted they'd been the last to see your missing friend, that she was sure of your innocence.<<endif>>\n\nAnd then this [[happened]].

passages.name: Take a breath
passages.text: Your head crests the surface. You'd acclimated to the cold, and now the warm air reminds you what you've lost. Muscles cramp. You can't feel your fingers.\nEnough. [[Enough.|Capitulate]]

passages.name: screaming
passages.text:
You come back to yourself, in the clearing. You are screaming. What must be hundreds of birds, starlings and jackdaws and rooks and crows, have taken flight in alarm. They blot out the moonlight. The witch watches, unperturbed.

"You'll have to look again."

You'd guessed. The knowledge doesn't make the prospect any more desirable.

[[look|Look 2]]

passages.name: listen mentor
passages.text:
<<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He's<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She's<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They're<<endif>> talking animatedly on the phone, as if <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he doesn't<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she doesn't<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they don't<<endif>> notice you're there. You wish that surprised you more. <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He sounds<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She sounds<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They sound<<endif>> <<cyclinglink $mentor "annoyed" "concerned" "indifferent">>.

[[try to make out the words|try mentor]]

links.text: try to make out the words

passages.name: "...go back?"
passages.text:
She nods. "Again and again." Her mouth is set. "Until something changes. You'll know. I won't."

She pauses, and looks as though she thinks better of it -

"I did this too, once, you know."

[["Really?"]]
[["Did it work?"]]

passages.name: No.
passages.text: She nods solemnly. "That's all right. You've borne a great deal. And you'll bear it still, out in the world. Your penance is done."\n\n[[(is it)|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: controlled burn
passages.text:
You flick the spiral of the lighter. The flame leaps to attention. Eager. Hungry.

There's something at the center of it. <<replace "Look closer.">> <<cyclinglink "A sword" "A chalice" "A hand" "A bird">>, burning white. <<endreplace>>

Slowly, almost reverently, you touch the tip of the flickering light to the paper.

[[consume]]

passages.name: a girl choking back tears
passages.text: <<set $face to "girl">>Her throat so thick with grief she can't speak, can't swallow. Your own throat closes with hers. She presses her forehead against the cool tile of the hospital wall, letting hot tears finally spill over. She was too late, you somehow know. Just five more minutes, if she'd just left earlier, hadn't missed that turn, had sped up at that yellow - \n\nAnd now she'll never get to say [[goodbye|until glen]].

passages.name: "Well...hi!"
passages.text: "Hey..." <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They're<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She's<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He's<<endif>> clearly uncomfortable. You thought you were friends; you'd <<cyclinglink "played football" "been at school" "spent hours talking about books" "grown up">> together. What happened to <<print $ghostgender1>>? What happened to you?\n\n[["How have you been?"]]

passages.name: savage friend
passages.text: <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He<<endif>> stood by your side, made your excuses for not coming out on nights when the hunger lay heavy on you. Sometimes <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they'd<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she'd<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he'd<<endif>> come by with a pizza and a <<cyclinglink "trashy B-movie" "nostalgic 90s chick flick" "mindless action thriller">> and watch it in silence with you, sprawled out on your couch. <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He<<endif>> never asked too much.\n\nYou swallow. You remember <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>. And what happened [[next|next 2]].

passages.name: peel back the light
passages.text: One layer of brightness. The one underneath it sears even brighter. Every lie you've ever told. Everything you've ever wanted to believe about yourself. The light crawls, a fractal pattern of your own construction. All the selves you've tried to build up, to keep you out.\n\n[[break through]]

passages.name: strike the snake
passages.text:
There's a twisted branch on the ground. You bend to grasp it in one fluid motion, bringing it down on the head of the snake. The mouse skitters off into the undergrowth. It whines in pain and outrage, as if it hadn't expected this from //you//. Yellow eyes glare at you accusingly. You're the same.

The witch looks at you. "Are you all right?"

[["I'm fine."]]
[["A bit shaken."]]
[["What just happened - "]]

passages.name: nothing is
passages.text: Evidently <<if $exgender eq "He">>he<<else if $exgender eq "She">>she<<else if $exgender eq "They">>they<<endif>> hadn't felt the way you did.\n\n(Weren't //you// [[enough]]?)

passages.name: enough 2
passages.text:
"Are you sure? You'll never know if you could have resolved it. But if it's too much..."

[[you're sure|you're sure 2]]
[[go back|go back 2]]

passages.name: enough 3
passages.text:
"Are you sure? You'll never know if you could have mastered it. But if it's too much..."

[[you're sure|you're sure 3]]
[[go back|go back 3]]

passages.name: further
passages.text: The water laps at your waist. A shock of cold pierces through you. The night air feels impossibly warm.\n[[deeper]]

passages.name: watch it smolder in the dirt
passages.text:
The paper turns to ashes in seconds. Regrets and sins consumed in moments.

[[If only]]
[[Let them go]]

passages.name: a hand?
passages.text: You wake up in <<cyclinglink $location "your own bed" "a white-walled hospital room" "an unfamiliar bedroom">>. Another part of you is missing. It's been happening long enough that you're not surprised. It might hurt, if you hadn't lost the ability to measure your pain somewhere along the way.\n\n[[get up]]

passages.name: hazy
passages.text:
Try to focus. Try to think. What is it you've lost, this time?

[[your heart]]
[[your hands]]
[[your skin]]

passages.name: "Not-experience is an experience in itself: the final one."
passages.text:
"Does it count as an experience if it cannot be processed in the way that we usually categorize events?" The corners of her mouth turn down. "I'm not sure it does. Experience involves recognition, understanding, reflection. Death involves none of that."

[["Maybe you're right."]]
[["It's an event people undergo - that's an experience."]]
[["You sound very sure."]]

links.text: "It's an event people undergo - that's an experience."

destination.name: "It's an event people undergo - that's an experience."

passages.name: No. 2
passages.text: She shrugs. "Perhaps not. Would the earthquake have happened if you had not sought absolution? Well." Her eyes glint in the moonlight. "Responsibility is a tricky thing, isn't it? Still, what matters is how you consider the situation."\n\n<<timedgoto "Turn back to the woods" 15s>>

passages.name: "Nothing's wrong."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They look<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She looks<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He looks<<endif>> unconvinced. "If you say so. But you've been moody and hard to talk to. I know you well enough to know when something's bothering you."

Rage courses through you. <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They //don't//<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She //doesn't//<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He //doesn't//<<endif>> know you. <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They don't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She doesn't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He doesn't<<endif>> know what's inside of you.

You stand up abruptly. A bit of the bitter porter sloshes over the lip. "I need some air."

[[escape]]

passages.name: ex memory
passages.text: You hadn't thought <<if $exgender eq "He">>he<<else if $exgender eq "She">>she<<else if $exgender eq "They">>they<<endif>> felt that way about you. You'd been through so much together. You'd shared [[weekends away]], let <<if $exgender eq "He">>him<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>them<<endif>> [[stay with you]] when <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> apartment flooded. <<if $exgender eq "He">>He'd<<else if $exgender eq "She">> She'd<<else if $exgender eq "They">>They'd<<endif>> picked you up at the [[airport]] after midnight when your flight was delayed. You had a standing Friday night pizza-and-terrible-movies date and played trivia on Tuesday evenings sometimes.\n\nThings weren't [[perfect]], but [[nothing is]].

passages.name: "What does it entail?"
passages.text:
"A way to live with what you are. It's worked before." She doesn't elaborate.

[[agree willingly]]
[[agree reluctantly]]
[[ask what happens when it doesn't]]
[[refuse|Walk away 2]]

links.text: ask what happens when it doesn't

destination.name: ask what happens when it doesn't

passages.name: others
passages.text:
"I'll warn you to be responsible, and to be kind. If you misuse this power, it will be your curse."

Her eyes blaze with that same light for a moment. Universes bud and bloom and wither in her sclerae.

"I know a bit about curses."

[[okay|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: alone
passages.text: The cold bites into you, the rage and hunger a dull throb. You didn't hurt <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>. You're alone with yourself.\n\n<<timedinsert 7s>>But it isn't real. You're not really in this alley. You're back in the [[clearing]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: wait
passages.text: "It will take some time." Her voice is not unkind. "All things worth having do. But you'll need to let it work in the world."\n\n<<timedgoto "Turn back to the woods" 15s>>

passages.name: "It's an event people undergo - that's an experience."
passages.text: "By that definition of experience, yes." She sighs. "I don't believe it's that simple. Perhaps it is. Either way, it will be yours alone."\n\nYou keep [[walking|to the location]] in silence, only broken by the occasional snap of a twig.

passages.name: An old fling.
passages.text:
She's cross-legged on the sofa, all <<cyclinglink $flingadjective "pantherine grace" "comfortable solidity" "sharp angles">>. You know her better than most of the people you've seen tonight. An interloper touches her shoulder, takes her offered empty glass before disappearing in the direction of the kitchen. Now's your chance.

You make your way over. Though the living room is full, bodies part to make space for you without noticing your presence, without brushing up against you or nodding. Your skin aches for contact.

"Hey." Her eyes are <<cyclinglink "dark" "bright" "laughing" "inscrutable">>, but she smiles as she greets you.

[["You look good."]] 
[["It's been a while."]] 
[["I didn't know you knew Yasmeen."]]

passages.name: Wormwood
passages.text: She raises an eyebrow at you. "Practical, aren't you? And maybe a bit ruthless. Well. I won't worry about you in these woods."\n\nShe tucks your offering into her shapeless - dress? cloak? you aren't sure. It rustles around her feet as the relentless chirp of crickets reaches a fevered height. She pays no heed, only continues [[on|on start]].

passages.name: Bear it
passages.text: The water sears your skin. Numbs your flesh. You can't tell where you begin anymore.\n\n[[take a breath|Take a breath]]

passages.name: airport
passages.text: Shivering in the cold, exhausted from delayed and canceled flights and the interminable interstitial space of airport gate areas, your face softened when <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> Ford Focus pulled up to the curb, and all you wanted to do was go [[home|ex memory]] with them.

passages.name: lying kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: into the wood
passages.text: She leads you through an overgrown wood, the sweet smell of rot just lingering. There is no sound but the rustle of leaves - are those leaves? - and the whisper of the wind - is that the wind? She does not turn to look back at you.\n\n<<timedinsert 7s>>At last, you arrive at a [[fork]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: Cat Manning

passages.name: "Where do your views come from?"
passages.text:
The witch turns an appraising eye on you. "Curious, aren't you? Well, I suppose you'd have to be, with your request." She looks upwards, into the branches. That strange light - it can't be moonlight, it's far too luminous - casts shadows over her cheekbones. Her face is half hidden.

"I remember my death." Her tone is conversational. She could be asking what you'd like for tea. "It was sudden, and it was lonely. And it hurt."

[["You...remember?"]]

passages.name: on start
passages.text:
"So." You round a bend, the forest floor giving way to a cascade of pebbles and leaves. You focus on finding your footing. "You've heard the stories. No one seeks me out who wants to live." Her voice is mocking.

"What on earth makes you want to risk death to find me?"

[[you can't forgive yourself]]
[[she's the only thing more frightening than you]]
[[it's something you haven't tried yet]]

links.text: she's the only thing more frightening than you

destination.name: she's the only thing more frightening than you

links.text: it's something you haven't tried yet

destination.name: it's something you haven't tried yet

passages.name: "What just happened - "
passages.text: "It happens." Her voice is gentle. "It's the way of the world. That doesn't make it bearable. We endure the best we can, as long as we can. I'm sorry you had to see that - you've had enough, haven't you?"\n\nIt feels very difficult to speak, all of a sudden. You [[continue]] in silence.

passages.name: tease a strand out
passages.text: The coil twirls upward, dissipates in a high singing hum. Something in your chest cracks open. The light winds its way [[in]].

passages.name: "It's been too long."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>Their <<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>Her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>His<<endif>> grin is easier after that. "It has! I'm glad to see you rejoining the world of the living."

Your own smile strains.

The bartender slides a pint towards you. You take an experimental sip: a dark porter, a bitter bite. It's not to your taste, but you can't exactly refuse a memory.

<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They raise their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She raises her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He raises his<<endif>> own glass to you. "Cheers, then. To changing."

[["To changing."]]

passages.name: yourself
passages.text: She nods. "There's infinite promise, there, after all. An entire lifetime."\n\nSomething stirs in her eyes, like dying embers. You don't want to look too closely. Not when there's a world inside you to [[explore|Turn back to the woods]] -

passages.name: you'd rather hear it from her
passages.text: "Good. There are many stories about witches. Very few of them are told by us." She grins; her teeth are white, and very sharp. "I prefer to teach by example."\n\n[[uh|decision]]

passages.name: "It hasn't helped yet."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They offer<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She offers<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He offers<<endif>> you a lopsided smile. "Not gonna stop me from trying, though."

Maybe it's the haze of the bitter beer, or the music's inexorable pulse, but that helps, a bit. It doesn't change the fact that you feel like a monster. But you don't feel quite as alone.

<<timedinsert 7s>>Of course, it's not real. You're not really in this bar. You're back in the [[clearing]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: two
passages.text: It's out in the world, now.<<set $confession2 to prompt("Write another down:"," ")>>\n\nYou have [[one]] more scrap remaining.

passages.name: deny it
passages.text: It wasn't what you wanted, or what you needed. Or you can't bear the feeling. Whatever has happened to you tonight will be left in the forest.\n\n[[Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: next
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They offer<<endif>> you a quirked smile - part invitation, part challenge - and <<if $vamplovergender eq "they">>gesture<<else>>gestures<<endif>> to the bartender. You already know <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she'll<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he'll<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they'll<<endif>> ask you if you want a drink. This is like watching a film play out inside your head, helpless to stop it or change the reel.

"Hey. Let me get you a drink - whisky, right?" <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> voice is <<cyclinglink $voice "rough" "sweet" "clear" "smug">>.

You ordered a whisky, you remember. You toasted each other, that sort of promissory oath that hints at tangled bedsheets in the most innocuous words. And then -

You clear your throat. Maybe you have a choice over how this goes; maybe you don't.

[["Right."]] How much can you really change? It's only in your head.
[["Actually, I'd rather a beer."]] You want to see how much - if anything - you can affect.
[["I think I'll pass."]] You don't want to relive this. Not if you can help it.

passages.name: live
passages.text:
You don't know that you'll be able to stop yourself. But you want to try.

The witch's mouth curves up. It might even be a smile. Without a word, her hand moves, like a bird in flight - 

a glowing sphere bursts from her fingertips, trailing whorls of golden luminescence in the air. The phantasm bobs along happily, darting back and forth between you and the forest.

"It will lead you back out."

The eager thing darts between the trees.

[[follow|CREDITS]]

passages.name: just a moment longer
passages.text: It's too new. Even the prickle of the chill setting into your bones feels vital. A chance for nerve endings to spark back to life.\n\nAfter a while, though, the novelty wears off, and you're just shivering in a pond in the middle of a dark forest. Best to [[get out|step from the stream]].

passages.name: until
passages.text:
You're back in the glen, their joy and stupefaction still singing in your veins. You blink at the sudden loss of unexpected intimacy. Your gut churns uncomfortably at the thought of being so close to someone else without their knowledge or consent.

"That isn't what you were expecting, I imagine."

[[nope]]

passages.name: breathe
passages.text: Cool night air. The smell of smoke. You feel new. Clean.\n\nThis will linger, long after the tree is hollowed out into ash, long after new seeds [[sprout|CREDITS]].

passages.name: "Fair enough."
passages.text:
She snorts, an indelicate, earthy, vibrant sound. "I doubt I've convinced you. But you'll see soon enough."

You realize that somewhere, the forest floor has turned bright. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

You catch half-finished glimpses of yourself, as you find yourself approaching a radiant [[glen|to the location]].

passages.name: labyrinth
passages.text:
The path itself twists about, loses its way in bramble-hedges and briar patches, until you feel you've already walked into the maze. Finally, finally, the narrow way widens, revealing a sprawling curve of stone. It stretches out in both directions farther than you can see.

You turn to the witch, a question in your eyes.

[["Will it be enough?"]]
[["How vast is it?"]]
[["Will I be lonely?"]]

passages.name: break through
passages.text:
No use. There's still more, cobwebs of light clinging to your hands as you plunge them in. 

[[untangle]]

passages.name: flee 2
passages.text: get away get away get [[away|Alley again]]

passages.name: lunge
passages.text: The last thing you remember seeing is an awful look of recognition, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: as always 2
passages.text: By the end of the evening, you've found yourself in the kitchen, trying valiantly to pretend as if you don't notice at least four people hanging on her every word.\n\nNone of them spare you a second glance. It doesn't surprise you. She didn't want you enough, after all. What do you have to offer her now? What do you have to offer [[anyone|as always]]?

passages.name: look at the witch
passages.text:
"You have to feel it."

Her voice is soft.

[[let it come|give yourself over to it]]

passages.name: pick him up
passages.text: He snuffles indignantly in your palm, but lets you handle him. He is very warm.<<set $has_hedgehog to 1>>\n\n[[place him on the rock]]

passages.name: Agree
passages.text:
She nods, pleased. "There's a place, not far from here. It will do. While we walk, you'll tell me why you risked coming here. What is it about death that draws you?"

The moonlight shines through the canopy of trees, casting silver light on both your faces. The branches stretch out above like arms, beckoning you home.

She looks at you for your answer. Why //are// you seeking this out?

[["Not-experience is an experience in itself: the final one."]]
[["Annihilation is a siren song."]]
[["It's the only universal human experience."]]
[[your reasons are your own]]

links.text: "Not-experience is an experience in itself: the final one."

destination.name: "Not-experience is an experience in itself: the final one."

passages.name: Interstitial wood gathering 2
passages.text: A small gap in the trees. A flat rock lies in the middle of the copse, covered in [[moss]]. Flowers, [[purple]] and [[white]], riot over a [[rotting]] log.

passages.name: "Sure."
passages.text:
You share drink quietly together, answering <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>>
 questions with the barest answers. When the ice clinks at the bottom of your empty glass, <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she looks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he looks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they look<<endif>> to you. Silence hangs between you, an unbridgable gulf.

"I should probably go," you say, not meeting their eyes.

You don't wait for a response before you're on your feet, heading to the [[alley|alley 2]].

passages.name: pushed
passages.text: Canceled lunches; flimsy excuses for her not come by and see the apartment, which is slowly sinking under dust and empty pizza boxes; phone calls that end with you silent, searching for some bit of bright news you can hold up for her approval. They've taken a [[toll|mother memory]].

passages.name: you're sure
passages.text: It's too much. It's too much. You know where to find her, if you can ever bear it again. But for now, you [[can't|CREDITS]].

passages.name: "...all right."
passages.text: You step back hesitantly to the edge of the pond. This time, you're prepared. You hope. You place both hands flat on the surface, so the light-lines meet their mirrors and converge. If they can.\n\nA flash, and then you're [[gone|gone Fangs 2]].

passages.name: strength cleverness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: you can't forgive yourself
passages.text:
Absolution. Your throat closes on the word. Instead you open your hands, palms up. She looks at you sadly.

"No magic works without a name."

[[say it|Say it]]

passages.name: "You look good."
passages.text: "So do you," she offers, after the briefest pause. As if she doesn't notice the dark circles. The dullness of your hair. How your skin's shrinking back from your brittle nails. Still - that's nice of her. She was always nice.\n\n[["How have you been?"|ask]]

passages.name: dissolve
passages.text:
You're back in the glen.

"Was that - real?" Your words come out choked.

She looks at you. "Does it matter?"

[[No|no ghost]]. You saw it; you felt it. It's real enough to you.
[[Yes|yes ghost]]. A vision is only a phantom. Like you.

passages.name: grasp for it
passages.text:
You can't hold it, not in your hands. The circle shatters under the pressure of the tangible world. Light streams out in every direction.

It's beautiful. More beautiful than the sphere, perfect and inviolate. Everything is dusted with gold for a moment - and then it's gone. But it was real. Whatever that means, in this strange space.

[[...|light]]

passages.name: accept
passages.text:
She takes your hand in her own. The geometries of her skin feel impossible. The lines on her palm are worn straight to the bone. The folds of her flesh tesseract, lifetimes hidden from you.

Together, you make your way to the fairy pool.

"We'll look in together, this time."

[[gaze|gaze]]

passages.name: inside you
passages.text:
You're sprawled on a riverbank you don't recognize, in a city that doesn't exist. You dreamed it once when you were eight, that summer your father read you //One Thousand and One Nights//, and wove a different story of the city every evening.

Not Baghdad: he said that Baghdad wasn't his to describe, but that Los Angeles was. Los Angeles, where he'd spent his childhood, where you'd never been. He told you about the red brick library with the wandering ghost, the vacant lots where the Black Death still lurked in the soil. He told you about the blonde model who would spend her days cruising down the Sunset Strip in a pink Corvette, beneath the giant billboards of herself smiling beatifically down on the city, and the year she ran for governor. He told you about the Roman villa overlooking the Pacific, and how the man who imagined it into being died before he laid eyes on the sprawling property.

His descriptions sparked your imagination. You didn't dream of Los Angeles that summer, though, not of any of the landmarks he painted so vividly. Instead, you dreamed of infinite castles and towns and sprawling metropolitan grids, always new, always there when you [[closed your eyes]].

passages.name: wait start
passages.text:
How long will you have to linger here alone? The coven gave you specific instructions. Go to the woods, bring some sort of offering. Lavender or sage, they suggested. Light a candle; she'll smell the smoke. They looked worried as they told you. As if they didn't want any part of this. As if they too might die for helping you.

You bought a candle at the co-op next to the coffeeshop where they meet these days. The girl at the register wouldn't meet your gaze.

You drew the salt circle, went [[widdershins]] three times, just as they said. You've been waiting, watching the flame. Your joints are stiff and numb.

A sudden [[rustle|rustle start]] from behind you.

passages.name: pond
passages.text:
The water ripples. There is no breeze. The air is cool and still. Slowly, your hands move on their own.

Your garments fall. Your feet carry you ever closer to the water.

[[step in]]

passages.name: look closer
passages.text:
The stone has been knocked loose by a scuffle. A snake chasing a mouse. Nature's ineluctable design.

The snake rears, about to strike. The mouse cowers, frozen.

[[do nothing]]
[[step between them]]
[[pick up the mouse]]
[[strike the snake]]

passages.name: a person frozen in surprise
passages.text: <<set $face to "person">>Their face is open, shock plastered across it. A room, covered floor to ceiling with canvases splashed with neon acrylics: intricate, intimate portraits of themselves, of others, just as open and raw as the look on their face. A letter in their hands. You can make out some of it, below the fold.\n\n"delighted to offer you a place in our progam" ... "graduates have gone on to exhibit their work at galleries such as" ... "in addition, a stipend covering tuition costs as well as room and board". Their heart [[jumps|until]] under their skin, hammering at tissue and bone.

passages.name: "I don't feel like drinking tonight."
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They offer<<endif>> you that rakish grin. "Picked a bad place for it, didn't you?" You don't return the smile.

"Listen, there's something I have to get off my chest." <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> expression sobers dutifully; <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They lean<<endif>> forward, attentive.

[["I'm capable of terrible things."]]
[["I'm a monster."]]
[["I've killed people."]]

passages.name: "I meant how absolute it is."
passages.text:
An enigmatic smile plays across her lips. "The universe is vast and complicated. But I understand your argument. Perhaps soon you'll understand mine."

You realize that somewhere, the forest floor has turned bright. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

You catch half-finished glimpses of yourself, as you find yourself approaching a radiant [[glen|to the location]].

passages.name: feed 2
passages.text:
The blood is still sluggish. Still warm, for a while longer. You've lived this moment in your dreams before. Your stomach turns. But you bend down anyways.

The hiss. The slurping sound. You still can't look at their face.

<<timedinsert 6s>>You feel [[sated|sated 2]]. You wish you didn't.<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: gapes
passages.text:
"Maybe you should go get a drink. Have you seen the kitchen yet? There's everything in there. Yasmeen's really outdone herself."

Without waiting for your response, without even brushing by you, <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>they melt<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>she melts<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>he melts<<endif>> into the crowd.

[[okay|okay 2]]

passages.name: reject
passages.text: It's not what you wanted. You'll stay in your own body, your hands in the web. If every human life has infinite variations on infinite emotions, surely it's worthwhile to catalogue the intricacies of your own [[heart|will]].

passages.name: wrap yourself up
passages.text: You take the blanket gratefully, swaddle yourself in it like a child. You've suffered. Not as they have. But you understand, now.\nThe blanket is warm. Grounding. [[Safe]].

passages.name: no ghost
passages.text:
"Real or not, you came to me. You wanted it to end. But you have choices. You've always had choices. Even when you've felt <<cyclinglink "lonely" "exhausted" "frightened" "miserable" "helpless" end>>. You came here for escape, not for death. If you'd wanted the latter you could have found it far easier." She shrugs. "Perhaps I'm wrong. But most of the ones like you don't know what they want. Or they do, but can't name it. Maybe you believe you're unworthy of it. Foolishness. That, if anything, shows you're human."

"So. Choices. I can give you what the stories say - or I can give you what you want.

[[ask for death]]
[[ask for change]]

passages.name: until rage
passages.text:
You're back in the glen, his anger and bitterness still twitching in your own jaw. You blink at the sudden loss of unexpected intimacy. Your gut churns uncomfortably at the thought of being so close to someone else without their knowledge or consent.

"That isn't what you were expecting, I imagine."

[[nope]]

passages.name: snaps
passages.text: It's over in moments. The only things you recall are the look of surprise frozen in his darkening eyes, and the <<cyclinglink $feeling "vindication" "horror" "regret">> coursing through you.\n\nAnd then the alley dissolves, and you're back in the [[clearing|clearing 3]].

passages.name: Accept
passages.text:
Accept. What you've done is your responsibility.
"Look after it. It will tell you what it eats."

The creature extends one clawed, webbed hand to you. There's nothing to do but [[take it]] in your own.

passages.name: okay
passages.text:
She pulls a vial from some hidden pocket in her skirt. Did she prepare it while you were looking around the forest, or did she bring it, knowing you would be in need?

"Just a bit will do."

<<if $has_toadstools>>She twists off one of the caps of the toadstools, drops it into the liquid. It glows white for a moment; smoke swirls ominously upwards. She notices your expression. "It's perfectly safe." 

[[drink]]<<else if $has_narcissus>>She drops one blossom into the liquid. It glows the faintest of blues for a moment. A silver sheen lingers on the surface. "It will be warm."
 
[[drink]]<<else if $has_hyacinths>>She drops one blossom into the liquid. The surface turns the dark grey of a thunderstorm. The potion ripples long after it should have stopped. 

[[drink]]<<else if $has_hedgehog>>She drops one of the spines into the liquid, swirls it and waits. It flashes bright green and luminous for a moment. A pleased smile crosses her face. "Sometimes it needs more, but this will work as it is." 

[[drink]]<<else if $has_moss>>She scrapes a bit of the moss into the liquid. Amber swirls radiate from where the lichen broke the surface. "You'll like the taste, I imagine. Sweet."
 
[[drink]]<<endif>>

passages.name: let him go
passages.text: He scurries back into the brush. You turn back to the [[copse|Interstitial wood gathering 2]].

passages.name: "Nothing."
passages.text: "Try again." You nod, gritting your teeth already. You bend towards the pool, extending your glowing palms to the surface of the water. \n\nYou don't expect a change. You don't expect anything. A flash of light, and you're [[gone|gone 2]].

passages.name: watch the tree blaze
passages.text:
Tendrils of fire caress the withered wood. It doesn't burn like any fire you've seen before - no slow blaze. The inferno is absolute. Branches splinter and crack open. The trunk gapes hollow.

You catch a glimpse of your words, barely, before the limb blisters black and grey.

[[listen]]

passages.name: your bounty
passages.text:
<<if $has_hedgehog>>The hedgehog noses a bit of moss curiously. The witch looks at you. "Wisdom, then? Well."

[[yes|Hedgehogresult]]<<else if $has_hyacinths>>The witch picks one up and sniffs it appreciatively. "When I was young, after a storm I'd run out to the forest just to see these bloom. A wise choice." 

[[okay]]<<else if $has_moss>>"I don't know why more people don't ask for moss." She's musing to herself. "Bloody useful, if you ask me." She seems to notice you again. "Right. Let's get on with it." 

[[okay|okay]]<<else if $has_toadstools>>A wide smile cracks the witch's face. "Brave of you. Don't worry, they won't be poisonous in the potion. I can't make any promises about the taste, though." 

[[that's...good?|okay]]<<else if $has_narcissus>>"Ah." Her smile is sad. "There are many reasons for choosing these. I'm sorry." 

[[oh|okay]]<<endif>>

passages.name: all that light
passages.text: Your eyes shine with possibility. Maybe you'll have to break that open too. It's all right. You have [[time|CREDITS]].

passages.name: mingle on the outskirts
passages.text:
<<if $newpersongender eq "him">>His<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>Her<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> eyes flicker over you as you elbow your way in, but <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>his<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>her<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>their<<endif>> story doesn't pause. <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>He turns<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>She turns<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>They turn<<endif>> back to a blond whose long-fingered hand covers a laughing mouth.

You lean forward, but you can't quite catch what <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he's<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she's<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they're<<endif>> saying. Something about football?

[[laugh along]]
[[respond]]
[[wait for a different opening]]

passages.name: remember
passages.text: You swallow, trying not to meet their gaze. <<if $person2 eq "lover">>You [[fail]].<<else if $person2 eq "friend">>You [[fail|fail2]].<<else if $person2 eq "foe">>You [[fail|fail3]].<<endif>>

passages.name: light
passages.text:
Your fingers itch. Now that you've seen the spheres smash, the light stream out, it's all you can think of. All that light, free. 

"You can do it again, you know." As if she's reading your thoughts.

"You have so many wishes to hold up, to break open. And not only your own. Every wish, or lie, or illusion does that, when you try to grasp it. There's a whole world out there."

[[all that light]]

passages.name: "What do you want?"
passages.text:
He holds his hands up in mock surrender. "Just saying hello. You haven't been out lately. Just seemed like something was //wrong//."

You hate that, how he makes himself sound perfectly reasonable. As if you're the damaged one.

Of course, you know he's right. You hate that too.

[["I'm fine."|vampenemyfine]]

passages.name: supplication
passages.text:
She traces the grooves of your palms; your lifeline, ragged and broken now. Life. Heart. Fate. You've never had much faith in palmistry - no //real// magic there - but the names come back to you with every line she traces. The liquid seeps into your flesh, glowing against your skin.

"There. You're finished."

[["Finished what?"]]

passages.name: Untitled Stylesheet 4
brutality kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: accept 2
passages.text: Infinite lives. Every emotion you can put a name to will turn kaleidoscopic under the unknowable gaps in the human experience. Unknowable except to you, that is. Too tempting to pass up. Or maybe you're that eager to leave yourself [[behind|will]].

passages.name: paper
passages.text: "Write your sins."\n\n<<timedgoto "three" 3s>>

passages.name: mistakes brutality
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: pick up the mouse
passages.text:
You turn your back to the snake. Not a wise move, but you're more dangerous than it is. Its fangs sink into your calf. You ignore the full pain singing beneath your skin, extend a trembling hand to the trembling creature. It sniffs you, cautiously, and then darts away into the undergrowth. It doesn't trust either of you.

The witch looks at you. "Are you all right?"

[["I'm fine."]]
[["A bit shaken."]]
[["What just happened - "]]

passages.name: perfect
passages.text: You'd fight sometimes, about how you rarely wanted to go out, and how <<if $exgender eq "He">>he<<else if $exgender eq "She">>she<<else if $exgender eq "They">>they<<endif>> didn't respect your need to recharge. <<print $exgender>> felt you never made an effort with <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> friends, didn't share enough of yourself. You'd make up, or at least decide not to be upset, and that seemed like [[enough|ex memory]].

passages.name: "You said 'won't'."
passages.text:
"I did, and I meant it." Steel in her voice. "We are capable of destruction, you and I. You won't force my hand. My way, or no way at all. That's the bargain."

[[walk away|Walk away 2]]
[["What does it entail?"]]

passages.name: take it
passages.text:
The creature's hand is <<cyclinglink "scaly" "webbed" "wet" "soft">> in yours.

"Have you found what you hoped to when you came to me?" Her voice is soft.

[[Yes.|Yes 3]] Something like it, at least.
[[No.| No 3]] You don't feel healed.

passages.name: "Listen, I can't see you anymore."
passages.text:
A long pause.

"Can you at least tell me why?"

[["I'm capable of terrible things."]]
[[lie]]

passages.name: "So are you."
passages.text:
"Thanks," and that's a real smile, now. "I ought to go see where Jaime's gone to with my drink. But I'll see you around?"

With that, she <<if $flingadjective eq "pantherine grace">> springs <<else if $flingadjective eq "comfortable solidity">>heaves <<else if $flingadjective eq "sharp angles">>twists <<endif>> herself off the couch, that <<print $flingadjective>>shining through in every line of their body. You wish you were that present.

She always had an energy about her: that's what drew you, that weekend away. That vitality singing through her blood. You thought perhaps you might -

[[but no|as always 2]].

passages.name: curses
passages.text: "You ought to leave, before you're tempted further." It isn't a suggestion. You'll have to [[live|Turn back to the woods]] with this now, manage your desire - if that's what you want to do.

passages.name: to the location
passages.text:
The glen pulses with a soft lambency. It's impossible to tell the source. Each tree, each leaf, each cracking twig beneath your feet seems to blaze with radiance. It's almost too much.

The witch spreads her hands apart. Between them is a ball of light. It's even brighter than the rest of the glen.

"Here." Her voice is soft, reverent. 

The light calls to you. You bend down to [[inspect]] it better.

passages.name: late
passages.text:
You come back to the clearing. Your mouth is full of blood.

The witch raises a brow at you. She doesn't seem surprised. "You'll do it again and again, until you learn." She sighs. "You'd better come back with me. This might take a while. I have somewhere you'll be safe."

[[...|labyrinth]]

passages.name: tramp
passages.text: Packed hard earth. The scent of rotting leaves. She seems not to notice your presence. Small blind beetles crawl over your feet. Glowing eyes follow you whichever way you turn.\n\nAs you pass beneath the trees' embrace, the shafts of light grow more luminous. There's a glen at the end of the path, almost too bright to look at. It's all you can do not to [[run|to the location]].

passages.name: "I'm a monster."
passages.text:
That gets a laugh. "A lot of people are."

"//No//," you insist, eyes wide and urgent. "I'm not speaking metaphorically. I //hurt// people. I don't mean to, but I do. It's - bad."

<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She's<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He's<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They're<<endif>> already shaking <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> head. "I can't see it. I really can't. I'm sure it's not as bad as you think it is."

[["It really is."]]
[["Whatever you say."]]
[["What would I need to do to convince  you?"]]

links.text: "What would I need to do to convince  you?"

destination.name: "What would I need to do to convince  you?"

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: Crossroads

passages.name: agree reluctantly
passages.text:
If she's bothered by your reluctance, she doesn't remark on it. The path you take is labyrinthine. Huge stones fallen across tangled roots, twists in the road, a brackish trickle of water in a creek bed. These are old-growth woods, untouched by fire but not by time.

The witch stumbles suddenly ahead of you. A rock's come loose.

[[look closer]]

passages.name: chattering
passages.text:
"Dry off."

She offers you a blanket. You don't recall seeing it before, but you've seen a great deal tonight you weren't expecting. 

[[wrap yourself up]]
[[face the cold]]

passages.name: eventually
passages.text: Eventually, your chest stops heaving. Your vision is blurred. The world runs.\n\n[[blink]]

passages.name: match its pulse
passages.text: Your breathing slows. The light twines itself around your hands. The caress is intimate.\n\n[[tease a strand out]]

passages.name: nod
passages.text: You can't remember the last time you felt this way. This whole. This vibrant. This alive. You hope it lasts. \n\nMaybe it even will. The night air sends a comforting chill through your skin, your hands, your beating heart. You [[breathe it in|CREDITS]].

passages.name: a pair of - fangs?
passages.text: You lean forward, trying to catch a glimpse of the pattern, but the bank is slippery. You lose purchase, reach one wheeling hand to steady yourself when it smacks down hard on the water - and suddenly, the forest is [[gone|gone Fangs]].

passages.name: Cast the stone into the water
passages.text:
It skips across the surface of the water. Your doppleganger's face shatters into fragments, blasted apart by the force of the impact.

<<timedinsert 3s>>The dark water knits back together. Your reflection looks at you reproachfully. Nothing.

[[look to the witch|"What will?"]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: Bay
passages.text: A murmur that sounds like approval. "Protection and strength. I can work with that. You're clear on what you want, then."\n\nShe tucks your offering into her shapeless - dress? cloak? you aren't sure. It rustles around her feet as the relentless chirp of crickets reaches a fevered height. She pays no heed, only continues [[on|on start]].

passages.name: hear indifferent
passages.text:
You can only grasp fragments.

"A reference? I - suppose I could..." <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They lean<<endif>> back in the chair, pursing <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>his<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>her<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>their<<endif>> lips. "No, nothing objectionable, of course... Dedicated, hard-working, polite..." 

<<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He's<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She's<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They're<<endif>> searching. " - be an asset to you, I'm sure - " " -can't think of any specific examples, but I do have quite a lot of - " " - hard to keep everyone straight, yes, thank you for understanding - "

You exhale a shaky breath, and are glad when the scene that's just unfolded starts to run at the edges and [[dissolve|mentor memory]] -

passages.name: "Actually, I'd rather a beer."
passages.text:
"Sure thing." The bartender slides a pint towards you. They could have asked, you think bitterly, but this bar //was// always a dive, and besides, it's only in your head. 

"Cheers," you say, light, before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she has<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he has<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they have<<endif>> a chance to speak.

"Cheers." That rakish smile.

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's [[screaming]] -

passages.name: "Will I be lonely?"
passages.text:
"Aren't you now?" Her voice is gentle.

"You'll learn its contours, and your own. If it's too much..."

She rummages in her pockets, produces a tiny silver thimble.

"Spill a drop of your blood into this, and I'll know you need me."

She doesn't offer you a knife. She knows you don't need one.

[[okay|labyrinth end]]

passages.name: hear concerned
passages.text:
You can only grasp fragments.

"A reference?" "Yes, I suppose I could..." <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They lean<<endif>> back in the chair, pursing <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>his<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>her<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>their<<endif>> lips. "I wish I'd been told of any of this." " - even when I receive a message, I often forget to respond, sadly - " " - should be able to blend in quite easily, won't ruffle any feathers - " "easy to overlook, but means well - " "do let me know if there's anything more I can assist with..."

You exhale a shaky breath, and are glad when the scene that's just unfolded starts to run at the edges and [[dissolve|mentor memory]] -

passages.name: flee
passages.text: get away get away get [[away]]

passages.name: bank
passages.text: The mud sucks at your feet, begging to drag you down. There's not much at the shore, just a couple of small flat rocks. One of them looks like it might skip well.<<set $has_stone to 1>>\n\n[[pick up the stone|Look away]]

passages.name: zombiepool
passages.text: "The pool." It still crawls with light. "If you step in - it will still hurt. I'm sorry. But it will help knit the wounds. Enough for you to bear the scars."\n\n[[step in|step in zombie]]

passages.name: Someone new.
passages.text:
Someone new.
<<cyclinglink $personoutfit "A tight neon dress" "A pair of heavy doc martens" "A vibrant full sleeve" "A crisp white button-down">> looks good on <<cyclinglink $newpersongender "him" "her" "them">>. A <<cyclinglink "sweet" "knowing" "smug">> smile. Loud laughter echoes in a corner of the room, where half-a-dozen people are hanging on every word.

[[mingle on the outskirts]]
[[approach directly]]

passages.name: Lie back
passages.text: It's hard to focus, in the haze of pain and drugs. That's another thing you've lost: the ability to be present. To feel. You try to fight it, but it's no use. You go [[under|rotting 2]].

passages.name: labyrinth end
passages.text: A last sorrowful look at you, and she disappears. The maze yawns before you. A [[haven|CREDITS]] of your own.

passages.name: "How have you been?"
passages.text:
"Good, good." <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They're<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She's<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He's<<endif>> clearly distracted, already scanning the room for someone else. "You don't have a drink yet? You should go get a drink. Have you seen the kitchen yet? Yasmeen's really outdone herself."

Without waiting for your response, without even brushing by you, they melt into the crowd.

[[okay|okay 2]]

passages.name: rotting 2
passages.text:
You come back to the clearing. The witch is pointedly not looking at you. You wonder how much she saw for herself, and how much is written on your traitor body.

"There is a way I can help." Still not meeting your gaze.

[[yeah right]]

passages.name: Hedgehogresult
passages.text:
Deftly, she plucks three spines from the hedgehog's back. He squawks indignantly and scurries away into a crevice. She shrugs.

"They'll grow back. They always do."

[[okay]]

passages.name: let them go
passages.text:
"They are gone, and cannot hurt you."

You can hardly hear the witch's voice over the fire's purring drone.

But she's right. Your confessions have stopped whispering.

[[breathe]]

passages.name: Except
passages.text:
You come back to yourself by the side of the pond. You've bitten clean through your lip. The water streams red.

"Well, that's new."

[["It was different this time."]]

passages.name: year
passages.text: Shouldn't you be enough for her as you are, insubstantial as you feel? She's your //mother//.\n\n<<if $mother eq "indifferent">>Does she still love you? The fear gnaws at you, hollowing you out even [[further|mother memory]].<<else>>You know she still loves you, even if it's strained. At least, you hope. The fear gnaws at you, hollowing you out even [[further|mother memory]].<<endif>>

passages.name: your reasons are your own
passages.text:
She raises a brow, but doesn't question you further. You tramp silently together through the woods.

You realize that at some point, the forest floor has turned bright. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

You catch half-finished glimpses of yourself, as you find yourself approaching a radiant [[glen|to the location]].

passages.name: Look 2
passages.text:
Back in the bar. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They offer<<endif>> you a quirked smile, again, and <<if $vamplovergender eq "they">>gesture<<else>>gestures<<endif>> to the bartender, again.

"Hey. Let me get you a drink - whisky, right?" <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> voice is still <<print $voice>>.

Can you change things, this time? If you try harder? If you find the right words?

[["I don't feel like drinking tonight."]] Maybe you can explain what's happening to you.
[["Listen, I can't see you anymore."]] An abrupt breakup might save <<print $vamplovergender>>, even if it hurts.
[["I'm fucking your brother."]] <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They<<endif>> ought to leave you alone after //that//.

passages.name: out
passages.text:
Your head crests the surface as you gulp down warm night air. Your breathing is fast and thick and desperate. Water streaks your cheeks. It might be tears. The cold is unbearable. The witch is watching from the shore.

[[endure|Endure]]
[[capitulate|Capitulate]]

passages.name: hhhh
passages.text:
You begin to feel a chill. You've grown used to even this.

[[step from the stream]]
[[just a moment longer]]

passages.name: Consider the knife
passages.text:
The blade glints in the moonlight. Blood will have blood, they say. But the witch looks at you. Her face is unreadable. Are you sure you want to do this?

[[yes|Yes]]. You're willing to bleed. [Warning: this option involves self-harm.]
[[no|No 2]]. The witch seems reticent.

passages.name: confess
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They nod<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She nods<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He nods<<endif>>. <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They don't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She doesn't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He doesn't<<endif>> seem surprised.

"Can you stop? If we helped?"

[["I don't think so."|admit]]
[["I hope so."]]
[["It hasn't helped yet."]]

passages.name: sparkle
passages.text: Your hands itch. You want so badly to [[turn back]] to the shards of light.

passages.name: "It really is."
passages.text:
"It's //never// as bad as we think it is. You're just carrying around too much guilt because you like feeling like a martyr."

Your blood thrums in your ears, indignant that <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they'd<<endif>> dismiss what crawls under your skin just like that.

"I'm not a martyr," you say. Quiet. So quiet <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can't hear you over the music. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She doesn't<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He doesn't<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They don't<<endif>> seem to care.

"Seriously, you need to just let go of the victim complex and - "

You can't listen anymore. Your face flames hot. You need to get out of there. Pushing past the pulse of bodies on the dance floor, you escape to the [[alley]] -

passages.name: turn on them 2
passages.text:
Claws. Teeth. Over. Again. You couldn't stop it. The body lies there. Red and mottled white. The iron tang of blood in your mouth. Acid at the back of your throat. 

<<if $monster eq "vampire">> [[feed|feed 2]] <<else if $monster eq "werewolf">> [[cover it with something|cover 2]]
[[flee|flee 2]]<<endif>>

passages.name: drink
passages.text:
<<if $has_toadstools>>The potion feels like swallowing fire. You wonder for a moment if the witch wasn't terribly mistaken, but then there's a thrumming in your veins. Is this what you had hoped for? 

[[wait]]<<else if $has_narcissus>>It is. Warmth radiates through your whole body, starting from your throat. You feel lighter, somehow. 

[[wait]]<<else if $has_hyacinths>>It's thicker than you thought it would be. It settles in your stomach.
 
[[wait]]<<else if $has_hedgehog>>You drink, hoping the gold spine has dissolved entirely. Luckily for you, it has. The liquid slides smoothly down your throat.

[[wait]]<<else if $has_moss>>It is sweet, but not cloyingly so - like a burst of fruit at the back of your throat. But the taste is like no fruit you know. 

[[wait]]<<endif>>

passages.name: look down
passages.text: Tiny alkaline droplets have scorched the ground where they've fallen. There are craters where nothing will grow.\n\n<<replace "(weep harder)">>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>drip<<becomes>>[[eventually]]<<endreplace>>

passages.name: struggle
passages.text:
It passes. You don't know how long. They're looking at you, confusion in their eyes.

"Are you all right?" You think their voice wavers. You wonder what you must look like.

"Fine." There's hardly a tremor in yours. Sweat beads your brow. "It's fine. I think I just. Need to call it a night."

"Sure, okay." It might be disappointment or relief or anger or concern in their eyes; you're not really paying attention. Perspiration trickles down into your eyes. Every system is straining to keep the monster back. To keep yourself back.

"I'll see you around," you mumble. It's all the breath you can spare. And you turn and [[run]] -

passages.name: ask
passages.text:
"Oh, terribly busy." She launches into an enthusiastic recounting of her latest exploits. Your head spins. How can any one person manage all that?

It was her energy that drew you to her, that weekend away. That vitality singing through her blood. You thought perhaps you might -

[[but no]]

passages.name: try to make out the words
passages.text:
You can only hear fragments.

<<if $ex eq "concerned">>"No, we'd never get back together; it's just friendly concern - " "always seemed so /absent/, even when we were together - " "hard to stay in love with someone like that, who might as well not even be there - " "still, I worry - I doubt there's anyone else to."<<else if $ex eq "annoyed">>"No, of course we'd never get back together - too dull, wasn't it? But I'm not at all surprised by - " "always so absent when we were together, I was just miserable - " "no, I'm not surprised you called me, I'm the most familiar with the - peculiarities of the situation after all, aren't I?" A harsh exhale of breath. "Sorry I couldn't be of more help, I haven't heard anything in months, and honestly I'm relieved."<<else if $ex eq "indifferent">>"No, we'd never get back together - why would we?" "- not enough to hold my interest, really, there was nothing there - " "still, I hope nothing's the matter."<<endif>>

You exhale a ragged breath. <<print $exgender>> <<if $exgender eq "He">>doesn't<<else if $exgender eq "She">>doesn't<<else if $exgender eq "They">>don't<<endif>> hear you.

You're relieved when the scene starts to run at the edges and [[dissolve|ex memory]].

passages.name: turn
passages.text:
She looks at you. Her gaze is level. She knows you for what you are. She might be the only one who does.

"You came to me to end the cycle. But you never wanted to die. You wanted this part of you contained." She shrugs. "Perhaps I'm wrong. But most of the ones like you don't know what they want. Or they do, but can't name it. Maybe you believe you're unworthy of it. Foolishness. That, if anything, shows you're human."

"You have a choice, still, of course. You can go back out into the world, as you are, and live with it - or you can stay here, locked in a labyrinth. Safe."

[[live]]
[[stay]]

passages.name: "I didn't know you knew Yasmeen."
passages.text:
"I didn't know //you// did," she says, raising a brow. "I haven't seen you out anywhere - not Sean's leaving drinks, or Katie's birthday."

You //were// at Katie's birthday. You don't remember the night well. You don't recall anyone you talked to, any meaningful conversations you had. You might as well not have been there.

[["Yeah."]] There isn't much else to say.

passages.name: apocalypse
passages.text:
There is a gash in the earth. The witch stands on the other side.

"This is the truth."

[[look at what you've done]]

passages.name: "I love you."
passages.text:
Now that's new. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> eyes widen. You - probably shouldn't have said that. But what's the harm? This is only a memory.

"That's a bit heavy for a Saturday night, isn't it?" Still, that <<print $voice>> voice is amused. You smile back, luxuriating in the respite of a salvaged moment. Even if it isn't real.

[["Maybe."]]
[["I had to say it."]]
[["Just keeping you on your toes."]]

passages.name: Walk away 2
passages.text: Not worth it. You might be a monster, but you're your [[own|CREDITS]] creature.

passages.name: feed
passages.text:
<<set $monster to "vampire">>You lower yourself to their neck. The blood will have gone sluggish and still, but it will still be warm, for a little while longer. You've been doing this long enough to know. And you're not wasteful.

The hiss of a puncture. An obscene slurping sound. You try not to look at their face.

<<timedinsert 6s>>At last, you feel [[sated]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: "Really?"
passages.text:
She nods, grim. She doesn't say anything more. You'll have to choose.

[["...all right."]]
[["I can't."]]
[["All right."]]

passages.name: your integrity
passages.text: <<set $lost to "integrity">>Something's rotted away inside you. Something that should have been steel and bone. But the years have worn you down. You've compromised so much. Is there anything left of you?\n\n[[...]]

passages.name: "What will?"
passages.text: She looks at you, sadly. One knotted hand reaches out to the pond. "You need to look. Watch, and wait. You'll know."\n\n[[watch the water|Watch the water]]

passages.name: blink
passages.text:
Your vision clears. In front of you is a small, hunched, misshapen thing. It looks at you silently.

"It's yours, now."

[[protest]]. You never asked for this.
[[accept|Accept]]. What you've done is your responsibility.

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
You want something.

Of course you do; everyone wants something. But what you want is - complicated. Not something you could get from your local coven, with their spells to find lost keys and their good luck potions. (You know: you've asked them.) 

That's what's brought you to the edge of the forest, the wild landscape at the edge of your city, at dusk. Their advice.

The wind whistles, frigid and bracing, around you. You turn the collar of your coat up.

[[wait|wait start]]

passages.name: tell them to run
passages.text: You clench your fists; claws bite into your own pulpy flesh. A high, singing pain explodes behind your eyes. You grit your fangs. Blood gouts from your mouth.\n\n"Run," you snarl. There's terror in their eyes, and disgust. Good. That's how you feel when you look in the mirror. They turn and flee. Great streams of your own blood have spattered the dumpster, the walls, your clothes. Nothing new. [[Except]] -

passages.name: look to the witch
passages.text:
"It's the best place for the ritual -  my own devising." She reaches into the voluminous folds of her cloak. A tiny green glass bottle sits in her palm. It glows faintly.

"Hold out your hands. Palms up."

[[supplication]]

passages.name: raise a hand in greeting
passages.text:
<<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They start<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She starts<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He starts<<endif>> slightly, as if <<print $ghostgender1>> didn't expect you to do that. One hand comes up hesitantly in greeting, as if <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>they aren't<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>she isn't<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>he isn't<<endif>> sure you're gesturing at <<print $ghostgender1>>. Too late to change your mind, now.

[["Well...hi!"]]
[["How have you been?"]]

passages.name: ask for death
passages.text:
She shakes her head. "I give people what they need. You want to end your current existence. Death is only one facet of an ending. All change is a kind of death. You'll see."

Her smile is not kind.

[[protest]]
[[accept]]

passages.name: follow the grey thread
passages.text: It's slow work, unknotting the twisted spirals. Your fingers start to ache. But when you get to the end, the light hangs loose. Your skin begins to slough off in great sheets, piling translucent fragments on the loose coil.\n\n[[pick them up]]

passages.name: Alley again
passages.text: The alley, again. The same fetid stench. But this time there's blood mingling with it. You look down. Your clothes. You'll never get away.\n\n[[snap back|snap back 2]]

passages.name: man 2
passages.text:
Rage pulses in his chest. A muscle jumps in his cheek. He tries to bite back his words. He doesn't want to hurt his lover, even though Jack hasn't shown //him// the same consideration.

"You can't treat me that way, as if my feelings are a joke." His words stick in your throat. That's so much kinder than what you - than what //he// - wanted to say.

You swallow someone else's sense of futility and [[loss|until glen 2]].

passages.name: sated
passages.text:
Blood trickles from the corner of your mouth. You wipe it away absently.

The body is cooling.

[[cover it with something]]
[[flee]]

passages.name: shiver
passages.text: A kind of music beyond music. Your hands ache for a keyboard, a lyre, a pen. Anything to get it [[down]].

passages.name: stay with you
passages.text: That weekend had been nice. <<if $exgender eq "He">>He was<<else if $exgender eq "She">>She was<<else if $exgender eq "They">>They were<<endif>> a bit frantic, on the phone to the landlord and trying to ensure <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> possessions were mostly salvageable, but you cooked dinner and murmured encouraging things, and <<if $exgender eq "He">>he<<else if $exgender eq "She">>she<<else if $exgender eq "They">>they<<endif>> tucked <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> head into your neck while you cuddled on the sofa, and you felt as if everything would be [[all right|ex memory]]...

passages.name: Yes. 2
passages.text:
The witch looks at you.

"Them, or yourself? No, don't answer. Just consider it. While you dig."

[[okay|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: white
passages.text:
Ah. Narcissus. Purity and cleansing. Perhaps you can use some of that.

[[pluck the blossoms]]
[[keep looking|Interstitial wood gathering]]

passages.name: No 2
passages.text: The thin blade falls to the earth. The witch looks pleased. "Good. It won't be as simple as that. There's blood magic, yes, but that won't do you any good here."\n\n[["What will?"]]

passages.name: savage lover gender
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She wasn't<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He wasn't<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They weren't<<endif>> the first, or the second.

But you liked <<print $vamplovergender>>. A lot. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They<<endif>> had <<cyclinglink "a striking laugh" "dimples" "a birthmark shaped like a dolphin" "a good heart">>, and <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she was<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he was<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they were<<endif>> a terrible cook ("couldn't even boil water," <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> said one night, wrapping <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> arms around you at the stove). <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They<<endif>> had a fondness for <<cyclinglink "Italian opera" "outdoor cycling" "contemporary art" "collecting old books" "trail hiking">> and you even learned to appreciate it, for <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> sake. You recall how <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> skin felt against yours, smelled of <<cyclinglink "talcum and rainwater" "cigarettes and clean laundry" "cedar and soap" "vanilla and incense" "salt and fresh sheets">>.

You swallow. You remember <<print $vamplovergender>>. And what happened [[next]].

passages.name: collapse
passages.text:
A familiar voice. Their back is turned towards you. Who is it?

[[your mother]]
[[your ex]]
[[your mentor]]

passages.name: place him on the rock
passages.text: Is he going to be all right there? Well, no matter. You've already moved him; you may as well. Hopefully nothing too bad will happen.\n\n<<timedgoto "your bounty" 5s>>

passages.name: refuse
passages.text:
"Are you sure?" She arches a brow at you. Still and thoughtful.

[[...no, you'll stay|agree reluctantly]]
[[yes, you're sure|Walk away 2]]

passages.name: general replace
lying bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[strength|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: pick them up
passages.text: They're reflective, tinged by the grey light. You see yourself in them. A bead of sweat as a prospective boss flicks through your resume, the itch to embellish rising in your chest. A holiday dinner, biting your tongue. Tension in your fingers, spread out on a white tablecloth, the other hand reaching for your glass of wine. Every falsehood, every twist of self-protection, every barrier to keep the world from seeing you as you are. All dead skin, cast [[aside]].

passages.name: sated 2
passages.text:
Blood trickles from the corner of your mouth. You wipe it away absently. As you've done so many times before.

The body is cooling.

[[cover it with something|cover 2]]
[[flee|flee 2]]

passages.name: stirs
passages.text:
"Fine." Your voice sounds strange to your own ears.

Your control is slipping; you don't have much longer. Somehow, he always does this to you - brings your secret shame out, leaves you alone to master it. 

You need air - you push past him, the feel of his body against yours only making the hunger clamor louder. The dance floor is a potential slaughter. You [[break]] for the freedom of the alley -

passages.name: You hate her for this
passages.text: Hot rage strangles you. She doesn't know. It wasn't that simple. They hurt you, too.\n\n<<timedreplace 12s>>How could she do this to you? How could she hurt you so much? How could she make you look at yourself? <<becomes>>How could you do this to them? How could you hurt them so much? How can you [[look]] at yourself?<<endtimedreplace>>

passages.name: "That specificity is what I'm looking for."
passages.text:
Her brows raise. "So you've done everything else there is in this world, then? Broken a heart at the stroke of midnight on a new year? Held your own child's cold body in your arms and lowered them into the earth yourself? Sailed a ship into a harbor where no one speaks your language, and tried to find a tremulous connection? The specificity of experience means nothing. Pain is specific. That doesn't make it desirable."

The light in the glen turns icy. Shards begin to fall between the intertwined branches.

"I'm sorry." She doesn't sound particularly contrite, but then, she hasn't struck you as a person for whom apology is frequent. "I have my views, and you have yours. But if you're looking for specificity alone, death is not your only option."

[["Fair enough."]]
[["I meant how absolute it is."]]

passages.name: a catastrophic misunderstanding of the consequences
passages.text:
"Yes." That's all she says. The silence stretches out.

<<timedinsert 7s>>At last, she offers you a hand. "Come on. I think I can find something to help."

She starts slowly towards the [[wood|Interstitial wood gathering]].
<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: "I'm not happy with my life."
passages.text:
A shrug. "Neither am I. But that doesn't mean you can't change things, you know? 'I am the captain of my soul," and all that."

Rage courses through you. As if change were that easy. As if you weren't trying to live a normal life, coming out to bars and meeting up with friends when all you want to do is lock yourself away and gnaw your own bones raw.

You stand up abruptly. A bit of the bitter porter sloshes over the lip. "I need some air."

[[escape]]

passages.name: listen
passages.text:
The crackle of dead wood. The pop of an errant spark. The hiss of flame. And your words, whispered, vanishing on the breeze.

<<print $confession1>>
<<print $confession2>>
<<print $confession3>>

[[let them go]]

passages.name: "Right."
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She slides<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He slides<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They slide<<endif>> the whisky down the bar to you. 

"To your health." A cheeky smile. Your cheeks burn; so does the whisky. 

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// -
