It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's [[screaming]] -

passages.name: closed your eyes
passages.text:
You remember this one now. You had forgotten.

Squashed pre-fab 70s Soviet cinderblock buildings rise south of the river, squatting close together as if they shared a secret. To the north, the soaring spires and sweeping buttresses of cathedrals mingle with elegant red-roofed apartments and shops and offices. Split forever by the river, its current insistent, ineluctable. Bridged by an elegant concoction of iron and steel that spans the banks like a web.

The sun is setting and you are on a hill by the river, looking out over both south and north. The grass is soft and new under your hands and the sunset shines gold on the water and on the cinderblock and on the spires.

Something [[twists]] in your chest, singing high and thin. A new kind of joy, maybe; or a sorrow at the transience of the moment. Or both together, separated, spanned by your heart.

passages.name: gone Fangs
passages.text:
An alleyway. <<cyclinglink $person1 "Your friend" "Your lover" "A stranger" "An enemy">>'s voice, close at your ear, murmuring something you can't make out. Everything is a haze of red.

[[turn on them]]
[[try to calm down]]

passages.name: keep breathing
passages.text:
<<timedinsert 1s>>The pond's surface begins to ripple. The ground trembles.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedcontinue 5s>>The earth cracks open<<endtimedcontinue>>

<<timedcontinue 7s>>a yawning maw you fear might swallow you<<endtimedcontinue>>

<<timedcontinue 10s>>it won't stop<<endtimedcontinue>>

<<timedcontinue 15s>>and then it does<<endtimedcontinue>>

<<timedgoto "apocalypse" 20s>>

passages.name: mistakes kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[strength|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: "You don't want to start this with me."
passages.text: He laughs, low and unpleasant. "And what would that be?"\n\nFangs grind into your own jaw. Your mouth fills with the tang of your own blood. You grin at him - a red, red smile. He recoils. It's too [[late]].

passages.name: alley
passages.text:
- only to hear a voice behind you.

"Hey, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to piss you off."

It's too late. The red hunger has you in its grasp. You turn on <<print $vamplovergender>>. The last thing you remember seeing is an awful look of recognition, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: cleverness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|cleverness bravery]].
You are capable of [[resilience|resilience cleverness]].
You are capable of [[strength|strength cleverness]].
You are capable of [[brutality|cleverness brutality]].
You are capable of [[kindness|cleverness kindness]].

passages.name: lie
passages.text:
You stammer out some excuse or another - it's a bad time in your life, you're thinking of moving, you've met someone else.

<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She just smirks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He just smirks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They just smirk<<endif>> at you. "I don't believe you."

Maybe it's not worth it. Maybe you just want a bit more time with <<print $vamplovergender>>. You smile, lopsided. It doesn't reach your eyes.

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's screaming, and you've been here before, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: "Oh."
passages.text:
You can't keep the disappointment from your voice. <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They frown.<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She frowns.<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He frowns.<<endif>> 

"It's been a while, hasn't it?" <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>they try.<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>she tries.<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>he tries.<<endif>>

"Yeah." Your throat feels dry. No other words come.

"I've just been busy...new job, and all." <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He<<endif>> won't meet your eyes. Flimsy excuses, as thin as pity.

"Same here," you murmur, for something to say.

The silence [[gapes]].

passages.name: dissolve clearing
passages.text: The witch watches you as you catch your breath, hands still held out in front of you.\n\n"You can go back, if you like. Tease out all the strands in you, all the ugliness you're too frightened to confront, and [[make yourself new]]. Or you can [[follow the threads]] into a new life, again and again if you can't bear what you've done. But I'll warn you - you'll have to do this again there too. It's not an escape."

passages.name: aside
passages.text: There are so many more. But as you reach they [[dissolve|dissolve clearing]] under your hands -

passages.name: listen ex
passages.text:
<<if $exgender eq "He">>He's<<else if $exgender eq "She">> She's<<else if $exgender eq "They">>They're<<endif>> talking animatedly on the phone, as if <<if $exgender eq "He">>he doesn't<<else if $exgender eq "She">>she doesn't<<else if $exgender eq "They">>they don't<<endif>> notice you're there. You wish that surprised you more. <<print $exgender>><<if $exgender eq "He">> sounds<<else if $exgender eq "She">> sounds<<else if $exgender eq "They">> sound<<endif>> <<cyclinglink $ex "annoyed" "concerned" "indifferent">>.

[[try to make out the words]]

links.text: try to make out the words

destination.name: try to make out the words

passages.name: revised continues
"I've killed people."
passages.text:
"Come //on//. That is the most pathetic excuse for a breakup I've ever heard. At least say something like you're running off to Cancun to become an aerial fire-eater, or something."

"It's not like that." Your blood thrums in your ears, indignant that <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they'd<<endif>> dismiss what crawls under your skin as a //joke//. "It's - I didn't mean to. But I did, and I can't - I don't want to hurt you too."

<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She rolls her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He rolls his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They roll their<<endif>> eyes. "So why tell me? Serial killers don't go up to their potential victims and say, 'hi, hello, I might murder you, heads up'. You'd be a terrible serial killer if you did that."

"I'm //not// a serial killer," you say, too loudly. (Aren't you?) People are starting to stare. Your face flames hot. You need to get out of there.

Pushing past the pulse of bodies on the dance floor, you escape to the [[alley]] -

passages.name: moss
passages.text:
The thick carpet is cool to the touch. Grounding. Peaceful.

[[Yes|moss 2]]
[[Maybe not|Interstitial wood gathering]]

passages.name: nothing
passages.text:
You're back in the clearing, again. There are no more birds to startle with your screams.

The witch raises a brow. "Again."

[["Enough."]]
[[go back]]

passages.name: "Maybe you have a point."
passages.text:
"I've seen a lot of both. But then, we all think we have. And you've seen something that made you come to me. Perhaps you'll see something else tonight."

As you walk, you realize that somewhere, the forest floor has turned bright. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

You catch half-finished glimpses of yourself, as you find yourself approaching a radiant [[glen|to the location]].

passages.name: "No."
passages.text:
"I thought not. You usually can't, at first. You'll have to try again."

[["All right."]]
[["...all right."]]
[["...go back?"]]
[["I can't."]]

passages.name: "I hurt myself."
passages.text:
The words hang leaden in the air. The wood is still and soundless. You wonder how you didn't choke on them.

They are between you and the witch, now, out in the world. Raw and true and stripped. It feels like bleeding, only you can't see a wound.

"Yes. You did. Do you know why?"

[[never enough]]
[[a catastrophic misunderstanding of the consequences]]
[[no]]

links.text: a catastrophic misunderstanding of the consequences

destination.name: a catastrophic misunderstanding of the consequences

passages.name: metal
passages.text: A thin blade with a bone handle, half-hidden in the tall grass. It's sharp.<<set $has_knife to 1>>\n\n[[pick up the knife|Look away]]

passages.name: your skin
passages.text: <<set $lost to "skin">>Thin and pink and raw. It used to be a barrier to the world. Now it's just an open wound.\n\n[[...]]

passages.name: Look away
passages.text:
Anywhere but at your face, at the mixture of water and salt. A sour tang rises at the back of your throat. There's not much to see at the edge of the water: grass luminous with dew, a muddy [[bank]], a glint of [[metal]] poking out from a patch of reeds.

The witch watches you. Her face is kind. Somehow that's worse.
<<if $has_stone>>
[[cast the stone into the water|Cast the stone into the water]]<<endif>>
<<if $has_knife>>
[[consider the knife|Consider the knife]]<<endif>>

links.text: cast the stone into the water

destination.name: Cast the stone into the water

passages.name: person 2
passages.text:
Their face is open, shock plastered across it. A room, covered floor to ceiling with canvases splashed with neon acrylics: intricate, intimate portraits of themselves, of others, just as open and raw as the look on their face. A letter in their hands. You can make out some of it, below the fold.

"delighted to offer you a place in our progam" ... "graduates have gone on to exhibit their work at galleries such as" ... "in addition, a stipend covering tuition costs as well as room and board" 

[[...|until]]

passages.name: er
passages.text:
If she's bothered by your hesitance, she doesn't show it. "My experience of death may not be your own, of course. You say it's the only universal, and that's true enough. But every death is personal."

You realize that somewhere, the forest floor has turned bright. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

You catch half-finished glimpses of yourself, as you find yourself approaching a radiant [[glen|to the location]].

passages.name: good advice
passages.text: You'd meet once a month or so, usually over dinner or drinks that <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they'd<<endif>> pay for. You always felt a bit like you were taking advantage of <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>his<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>her<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>their<<endif>> largesse, but <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> reassured you <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> could afford to be generous with beginners.\n\n<<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They<<endif>> tried to get you to open up, take more initiative with your ideas, speak up for yourself a bit more. //You// thought it was working, that <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> knew you and your aspirations. Evidently <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> didn't [[agree|mentor memory]].

passages.name: "I hope so."
passages.text:
"We will, you know. I will. Whatever it takes."

You know it won't be that easy. But for a moment, amidst the haze of the bitter brew and the music's inexorable pulse, you feel something new. Hope.

<<timedinsert 7s>>Of course, it's not real. You're not really in this bar. You're back in the [[clearing]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: try mentor
passages.text: <<if $mentor eq "annoyed">>A harsh exhale. The sound of fingers drumming on the desk. You strain to [[hear|hear annoyed]].<<else if $mentor eq "indifferent">>An impatient sighing. You strain to [[hear|hear indifferent]].<<else if $mentor eq "concerned">>A worried murmur. You strain to [[hear|hear concerned]].<<endif>>

passages.name: look at what you've done
passages.text: A deep scar in the clearing. The fault gouge jagged and bare. A cataclysm of shattered wood and scattered leaves. Pale roots exposed to the sky. The pristine landscape blasted.\n\n[[carnage]]

passages.name: "What are the terms?"
passages.text:
"A ritual, first. To ensure that it's death itself you truly seek, not just the boundaries of experience. Not-experience isn't the same, you know." The witch shakes her head, her close-cropped curls an eerie corona in the moonlight.

"If it is - " she shrugs. "Well. That's my bargain."

[[Agree]]
[[Decline]]

passages.name: resonate with the frequency
passages.text: You splay your hands out across the light. It shifts under your hands like a living creature, soft and tentative and breathing.\n\n[[match its pulse]]

passages.name: never enough
passages.text:
A sadness in her eyes.

"Come. There will be something in the woods that can help."

She gestures towards the [[forest|Interstitial wood gathering]].

passages.name: JS
wait for a different opening
passages.text:
<<if $newpersongender eq "him">>He goes<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>She goes<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>They go<<endif>> on like this for some time, trading the spotlight with the group enough to seem self-effacing, but the conversation always circles back to <<print $newpersongender>>. <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>His<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>Her<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> bright charisma. You wait, and think, but you can't find anything to say that will match that warmth.

At the end of the evening, <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he slips<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she slips<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they slip<<endif>> away with the blond.

That's [[nothing|as always]] new.

passages.name: Untitled Stylesheet 5
until glen 2
passages.text:
The glen, again. The shards of light still scattered. The gleam draws your eye. You can't help but glance. The witch looks exasperated.

"//People//.  Always drawn by the light, by the fantasy of getting that close to another person. But it has consequences. You're rummaging around inside other people's heads and hearts. Even //vampires// ask to be invited over the threshold."

A keening [[cry]] from overhead. A bird of prey?

passages.name: snap back
passages.text:
You are at the edge of the pond again. The witch is watching you.

"You couldn't change it, could you?"

[["No."]]

passages.name: "Connection isn't more important than experience."
passages.text:
"I suppose that depends who you're asking, doesn't it? It is for me. It isn't for you. You'll still get your experience; I won't deny you it. But not before connection. They go together, you know. Experience is all well and good, but sooner or later there's the itch to do something with it - to share it with another, to make art, to provide others with the same chance. They're linked."

As you walk, you realize that somewhere, the forest floor has begun to glow. Fragments of that strange light are strewn beneath your feet, like glass or gems. You can see your face distorted in them.

[[to the location]]

passages.name: Breathe
passages.text:
<<timedreplace 10s>>Breathe. <<cyclinglink "In." "Out." "In." "Out.">><<becomes>> 

You come back to yourself, in great gulping sobs. Your cheeks and chin are wet with tears.

"You've seen, then."

[[yes.|Yes 2]]<<endtimedreplace>>

passages.name: that's not what light does
passages.text:
You can't hold it, not in your hands. 

The circle shatters under the pressure of the tangible world, by its mere existence. Light streams out in every direction.

It's beautiful. More beautiful than the sphere, perfect and inviolate. Everything is dusted with gold for a moment - 

and then it's gone. But it was real. Whatever that means, in this strange space.

[[...|light]]

passages.name: turn on them
passages.text:
A snick of claws, a flash of teeth, and it's over. The body lies still, daubed red and mottled white. The iron tang of blood in your mouth. Are their lips already starting to darken?

[[feed]]
[[not that kind of monster]]

passages.name: try to calm down 2
passages.text:
You clench your fists, focus on your breathing. You have good lung capacity - it's useful for hunting prey. But now it serves as a challenge - to fill your mouth with night air and not their flesh, sweet and soft and yielding beneath your teeth, a bright burst on your tongue.

"So easy," a voice whispers. "Right there."

You [[struggle]].

passages.name: "I didn't want to be alone."
passages.text:
A laugh, at that. "Who does?"

The bartender slides a pint towards you. You take an experimental sip: a dark porter, a bitter bite. It's not to your taste, but you can't exactly refuse a memory.

<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They raise their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She raises her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He raises his<<endif>> own glass to you. "Cheers, then. To changing."

[["To changing."]]

passages.name: carnage
passages.text: White roots reach down, blindly groping back towards home. They root themselves again in soil, disappear from view. They'll grow back. Some things do.\n\n[[try to breathe]]

passages.name: alley 2
passages.text: The cold bites into you, the hunger a dull throb, your sense of loss warring with it. But at least you didn't hurt <<print $vamplovergender>>. You're alone with yourself.\n\n<<timedinsert 4s>>But it isn't real. You're not really in this alley. You're back in the [[clearing]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: You want to cry
passages.text:
A thick, ugly sob wells up in your throat. What you've done is a wound in the world. You don't know how to make it right. That's why you're here.

[[look at the witch]]
[[give yourself over to it]]

passages.name: bravery kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: "It didn't hurt enough."
passages.text:
She is quiet, for a long time. When she speaks, her voice is softer than you expected.

"There is not a measured amount of suffering weighed out for every sin. But if you feel the need to do penance..."

She holds out a hand to you.

[[take her hand]]

passages.name: hear annoyed
passages.text:
You can only grasp fragments.

"A reference? I suppose I could..." <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She leans<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They lean<<endif>> back in the chair, pursing <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>his<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>her<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>their<<endif>> lips. " - not in weeks, though; this is the first I've heard of these plans - " "can't possibly speak to organization or communication skills, with this latest lapse - " " - why the silence, I can't think - " 

An irritated exhale. " - hard-working and polite, and I have wanted to do my best - " another harsh breath. "But it's been difficult."

You exhale a shaky breath, and are glad when the scene that's just unfolded starts to run at the edges and [[dissolve|mentor memory]] -

passages.name: submerge
passages.text: <<once>>Your existence has narrowed to a bright sear. There is no breath left in your body. Dormant nerves are shocked alive into agony. You need to get [[out]] of this - <<endonce>>

passages.name: him
passages.text: You grit your teeth. Your mouth fills with the tang of your own blood.\n\nYou're so close, so close to [[snapping|late]] -

passages.name: cover it with something
passages.text: It's the least you can do. You pull a pair of gloves from your jacket pocket. You're careful, in the ways you still can be. You've come to value these small rituals, ways of clinging to your humanity. Always cover the body. Never leave fingerprints. Every once in a while, report a missing person from a pay phone 40 miles out of town, waiting in the booth until your hands stop shaking.\n\n[[snap back]]

passages.name: Right
passages.text:
The thronging branches block out almost all light, but a soft glow clings to some of the leaves. The trees are bathed in a soft blue phosphorescence.

<<timedinsert 5s>>As you walk, your eyes adjust.

What you first took for bioluminescence, perhaps some kind of algae, are thousands of cold cathodes, sprouting from the branches. Neon glares off the trees; you realize that somewhere along the path, wood has been transmuted into steel.

Birdsong strobes in the branches, a relentless techno drone. Sweat [[drips]] from your forehead.<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: cover 2
passages.text: You make short work of the body. How many times have you done this, now? Gloves on. Tarp, if you can find one; their jacket, if you can't. Newspaper, sometimes. Quarter after quarter in a lonely phone booth out on the highway. You've lost count. Your hands are shaking.\n\n[[snap back|snap back 2]]

passages.name: Walk away
passages.text:
The price is too high. Or you don't feel responsible for yet another heart.

Whatever your reasons, [[turn your back|CREDITS]] on them. 

The witch will watch you go, her hand clasping the creature's own.

passages.name: turn back
passages.text:
What draws you this time?
<<if $face eq "man">>
[[a girl choking back tears|girl 2]]
[[a person frozen in surprise|person 2]]<<else if $face eq "girl">>
[[a person frozen in surprise|person 2]]
[[a man with a clenched jaw|man 2]]<<else if $face eq "person">>
[[a girl choking back tears|girl 2]]
[[a man with a clenched jaw|man 2]]<<endif>>
[[your own possibilities]]

links.text: a man with a clenched jaw

passages.name: cry
passages.text:
"Still, I can't control you. Once it's out in the world..."

"I'll warn you to be responsible, and to be kind. If you misuse this power, it will be your curse."

Her eyes blaze with that same light for a moment. Universes bud and bloom and wither in her sclerae.

"I know a bit about curses."

[[...|curses]]

passages.name: kindness bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: "It's the only universal human experience."
passages.text:
She cocks her head to the side. "I won't deny that. Death can't be shared: not death itself. Fear, desire, grief, longing: they're all inexhaustible. Perpetually generating. But that moment - that's all there is. Discrete and entire in itself. And awful in its truth."

Her voice sounds fond, as if she's describing an old friend.

[["Maybe you have a point."]]
[["Connection isn't more important than experience."]]
[["That specificity is what I'm looking for."]]
[["Where do your views come from?"]]

links.text: "That specificity is what I'm looking for."

destination.name: "That specificity is what I'm looking for."

passages.name: find your clothes
passages.text:
Jeans. Shoes. Shirt. Coat. They're strewn about, but easy enough to locate. Your anonymous paramour doesn't seem to note you prowling about the room. You pull your clothes on, taking inventory of the parts that feel newly numb and dead.

[[your heart]]
[[your hands]]
[[your skin]]
[[your integrity]]

passages.name: lying strength
passages.text:
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: respond
passages.text: "Er - I suppose," <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he says<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she says<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they say<<endif>>, <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>his<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>her<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>their<<endif>> head swiveling towards you for a half second. <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>His<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>Her<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> composure is broken momentarily. "But really - " and <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they<<endif>> turns back to the hangers-on, to the tale <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he's<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she's<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they're<<endif>> spinning, with no further thought for you.\n\n[[as always|wait for a different opening]]

passages.name: Turn back to the woods
passages.text:
The witch watches you. Without a word, her hand moves, like a bird in flight - 

a glowing sphere bursts from her fingertips, trailing whorls of golden luminescence in the air. The phantasm bobs along happily, darting back and forth between you and the forest.

"It will take you where you need to go."

The eager thing darts between the trees.

[[follow|CREDITS]]

passages.name: rustle start
passages.text:
She doesn't //look// like a witch: not in the ways you've heard, anyway. Her face is lined, but she isn't wizened; she clutches a knotted oak staff, but her hands splay loosely across it, and her weight shifts easily as she peers at you. 

The murmur of wings. You are aware of dozens of beady eyes staring out of the gathering twilight behind her.

"You're waiting for me," she observes.

[["They told me where to find you."]]

links.text: "They told me where to find you."

destination.name: "They told me where to find you."

passages.name: fail
passages.text: You never could [[look|savage lover gender]] away from <<cyclinglink $vamplovergender "her" "him" "them">>.

passages.name: Try again 2
passages.text: Different, this time. A crowded nightclub. A <<cyclinglink $person2 "lover" "friend" "foe">>, arching a brow at you from across the bar. Oh no. You [[remember]] this night.

passages.name: still
passages.text:
It wasn't real, but at least you had that moment. At least you salvaged something. Even if it wasn't enough for <<print $vamplovergender>>.

<<timedinsert 3s>>It wasn't enough for <<print $vamplovergender>>. Remorse crushes your chest.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 3s>>You [[turn]] to the witch. Your heart feels tight against your ribs.<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: clearing
passages.text:
She looks at you. Her gaze is level. She knows you for what you are. She might be the only one who does.

"You came to me to end the cycle. But you never wanted to die. You wanted this part of you contained." She shrugs. "Perhaps I'm wrong. But most of the ones like you don't know what they want. Or they do, but can't name it. Maybe you believe you're unworthy of it. Foolishness. That, if anything, shows you're human."

"And now it has been. Or at least, you know you can. You have a choice, still, of course. You can go back out into the world, as you are, and live with it - or you can stay here, locked in a labyrinth. Safe."

[[live]]
[[stay]]

passages.name: away
passages.text:
You catch your breath in another dingy alley, teeming with the fetid stench of garbage. But no blood. Not that kind of rot. This sort of putrefaction is almost welcome.

You couldn't face it, couldn't look at it one moment more. You take a breath of sweetly rotting refuse.

[[snap back]]

passages.name: enough
passages.text: You know it's not that simple. But the thought still [[gnaws|dissolve]] at you.

passages.name: "Okay."
passages.text: "You'll have to decide." Her voice is solemn. "If you're going to use this only for [[yourself]], or if you'll look at the lives of [[others]] as well. I must warn you, though, against involving yourself in the futures of others without their consent, against violating the boundaries of another human being."

passages.name: shake yr head
passages.text:
She shrugs. "You'll see. It might take a while to become accustomed to. If you truly don't feel it's taken in a fortnight, come back and see me." She doesn't specify what will happen then. She doesn't need to.

"Wait and see." You might as well.

For now, you can still feel the effects. The night air sends a comforting chill through your skin, your hands, your beating heart. You [[breathe it in|CREDITS]].

passages.name: "I hurt them."
passages.text:
The words hang leaden in the air. The wood is still and soundless. You wonder how you didn't choke on them.

They are between you and the witch, now, out in the world. Raw and true and stripped. It feels like bleeding, only you can't see a wound.

"Good. Tell me how it feels."

[[you feel empty|You feel empty]]
[[you want to cry|You want to cry]]
[[you hate her for this|You hate her for this]]

passages.name: mother memory
passages.text: You hadn't thought she felt that way about you. You're her <<cyclinglink "child" "daughter" "son">>; isn't //she// supposed to reach out? Love you unconditionally? But you've [[pushed]] her [[away|away mother]] over the last [[year]].\n\nThe world [[spins|dissolve]].

passages.name: nope
passages.text:
She bares her teeth. Almost a smile. But not quite. Her eyes are flat.

"Uncomfortable, isn't it? Catching a glimpse of someone else's life without their consent. I didn't know you'd do that. I might have warned you, otherwise. Still, what's done is done; you'll be able to see those patterns, now, follow those facets into every possible experience."

She pauses, sizing you up. "Of course, you can look at yourself, find your own strands. Remain entirely in your own skin. You contain every one of those infinite possibilities as well; you needn't have had to //experience// something just to feel it. Not anymore."

A [[sparkle]], from the corner of your eye.

passages.name: "...I wish I'd been a better friend."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They don't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She doesn't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He doesn't<<endif>> know what to say to that, concealing <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>his<<endif>> hesitation with a sip of beer. "You haven't been a bad friend. I think...you've done what you were capable of, at the time."

Your throat is suddenly tight. That feels true. Even if <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they don't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she doesn't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he doesn't<<endif>> mean it as you hear it, for a moment, understanding washes over you.

And then it's gone, too suddenly, and you're back in the [[clearing]] -

passages.name: What you've been looking for
passages.text: Your hands make quick work of the tiny mushrooms. They're poisonous, though. Don't touch your mouth.<<set $has_toadstools to 1>>\n\n[[take them to the rock|your bounty]]

passages.name: girl 2
passages.text: <<set $face to "girl">>Her throat so thick with grief she can't speak, can't swallow. Your own throat closes with hers. She presses her forehead against the cool tile of the hospital wall, letting hot tears finally spill over. She was too late, you somehow know. Just five more minutes, if she'd just left earlier, hadn't missed that turn, had sped up at that yellow - \n\nAnd now she'll never get to say [[goodbye|until glen 2]].

passages.name: come
passages.text:
"I haven't seen your sort of...problem in some time. And I can't reverse this. I'm sorry." She looks it. "I can't - I won't - do what you ask. But there's something else I can do that may help."

[["What is it?"|"What does it entail?"]]
[["You said 'won't'."]]

passages.name: "Will it be enough?"
passages.text: She smiles sadly at you. "It will be enough to keep you safe. For the rest - you're the only one who will be able to know."\n\n[[okay|labyrinth end]]

passages.name: fail3
passages.text:
You've always felt he knew what you are, or at least suspected. It made you prickle around him, your instincts restrained under curt jabs and awkward silences. Better than giving him proof. 

He's a lot like you; the version of yourself you'd want to be. That you could be, if this weren't living in your blood. He knows, too, how much you wish you could be him. It hasn't made him any kinder.

He offers you a tight, <<cyclinglink "smug" "triumphant" "disgusted" "condescending">> look and swings down off the stool. He's heading over. You can't escape this.

"Surprised you'd show your face here." 

Your fangs grind involuntarily.

[["What do you want?"]]
[["Fuck off."]]
[[walk away]]

passages.name: fail2
passages.text: <<cyclinglink $vampfriendgender "They" "He" "She">> did so much to help you. <<if $person1 eq "friend">>You [[remember|savage friend gender]].<<else>>You [[remember|savage friend]].<<endif>>

passages.name: many
passages.text: Every possibility, potentiality, spread out before you like the roots of an ancient oak. All yours. And every human has as many. Your head [[spins]] as you try to imagine that number.

passages.name: try to calm down
passages.text: Your blood pulses, an inexorable song. You cannot calm down.\n\n[[turn on them]]

passages.name: admit
passages.text:
Your friend exhales. "Fair enough. Still, I thought it was worth asking. If there was anything I could do, I'd want to."

Maybe it's the haze of the bitter beer, or the music's inexorable pulse, but you believe <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>. It doesn't change the fact that you feel like a monster. But you don't feel quite as alone.

<<timedinsert 7s>>Of course, it's not real. You're not really in this bar. You're back in the [[clearing]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: not enough
passages.text: Only a reminder that you could have loved <<print $vamplovergender>>. If you hadn't hurt <<print $vamplovergender>>.\n\nIt hurts. A gnawing emptiness in your chest. You [[turn]] to the witch. Your head feels so heavy.

passages.name: "Are you sure you want to do this?"
passages.text:
His face slips into surprise for a moment. "Hey, I'm not trying to do anything."

Do you believe him? 

Does it matter?

You blame [[him]]. He stirred this up, whether he meant to or not. He deserves it.
It's [[your]] responsibility. Whatever he meant, your reactions are your own, and no one else's.

passages.name: Yes
passages.text:
The knife sings through your flesh. Crimson droplets spatter across the surface of the water, the muddy rocks, the dewy grass. Your reflection ripples. Your blood sinks into your doppleganger's face.

<<timedinsert 5s>>
Nothing happens. The <<cyclinglink $skin "pale" "dark" "scarred">> flesh staring back at you is still your own. You've paid in blood, and nothing's changed.

The witch clears her throat. "It's not as simple as that. There's blood magic, yes, but that won't do you any good here."

[["What will?"]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: Closer
passages.text:
You begin to recognize expressions on the faces. One stands out to you.

[[a girl choking back tears]]
[[a man with a clenched jaw]]
[[a person frozen in surprise]]

links.text: a man with a clenched jaw

destination.name: a man with a clenched jaw

passages.name: Decline
passages.text:
She shrugs. "You know my terms. If you change your mind...you've found me once. You can again."

She turns and hobbles back into the wood, leaning on her staff.

You are alone with your thoughts.

[[Is this really what you wanted?]]

links.text: Is this really what you wanted?

destination.name: Is this really what you wanted?

passages.name: mistakes strength
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: step in
passages.text:
Cold.
<<timedinsert 2s>>Cold.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 4s>>Cold.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 6s>>Countless tiny pinpricks bite your skin. Thick mud pulls you inexorably downwards. You have so far to go.
[[further]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: consume
passages.text:
Faster than you think - <<timedinsert 1s>>the flame jumps -<<endtimedinsert>> <<timedinsert 2s>>the tree bursts into conflagration.<<endtimedinsert>> <<timedinsert 3s>>Orange and purple tongues of fire lick at dry wood. The edges of the paper crack and blacken. 

You drop the paper - it burns too quick to hold.

[[watch it smolder in the dirt]]
[[watch the tree blaze]]<<endtimedinsert>>

links.text: watch it smolder in the dirt

destination.name: watch it smolder in the dirt

passages.name: you're sure 3
passages.text: It's too much. It's too much. You know where to find her, if you can ever bear it again. But for now, you [[can't|CREDITS]].

passages.name: you're sure 2
passages.text: It's too much. It's too much. You know where to find her, if you can ever bear it again. But for now, you [[can't|CREDITS]].

passages.name: take her hand
passages.text:
It is warm and soft in your own. Your fingers feel clammy against the pulsing life in her veins.

<<timedinsert 5s>>She leads you to the edge of the clearing. A blasted, withered tree stands there. The bark is wet. The smell of petrol rises in the air.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>"It's a cypress pine." Her voice is so gentle you have to strain to hear it. "It isn't native to the forest, but it's here. The only way it can sow new seeds is to burn."

She looks at you.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>[[um]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: decline
passages.text: Too high a price to pay without knowing. You know where to find her, if you change your mind. The edge of the woods [[beckons|CREDITS]] you.

passages.name: "You sound very sure."
passages.text: "Mine didn't." Her voice is tart. She says nothing more.\n\nYou keep [[walking|to the location]] in silence.

passages.name: cycling
snap back 2
passages.text:
You are at the edge of the pond again. The witch is watching you.

"Nothing?"

[["Nothing."]]

passages.name: three
passages.text: Your words. Your wounds. Black ink.<<set $confession1 to prompt("Write it down:"," ")>>\n\nYou have [[two]] more scraps remaining.

passages.name: cared
passages.text: Some days you even thought <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he was<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she was<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they were<<endif>> [[fond|mentor memory]] of you.

passages.name: gaze
passages.text:
The same wavering figure in the water as you saw before. Insubstantial. But the witch -

You can't look. Light pours from her mirrored image, nearly blinding you. She gestures at her reflection.

"That's you, too."

[[uh]]

passages.name: moss 2
passages.text: You scrape a bit of the luminous green lichen up, and try not to think about how it will taste.\n<<set $has_moss to 1>>\n[[bring it to the rock|your bounty]]

passages.name: life
passages.text: You are capable of [[life|CREDITS]].

passages.name: deeper
passages.text: At your neck, now. Your teeth are chattering.\n[[submerge]]

passages.name: spit
passages.text: It feels cleaner, somehow, even though you can still taste iron. You [[meet her gaze|clearing]].

passages.name: fire
passages.text:
The tree's bark is covered with your words. "<<print $confession1>>" twines about the trunk. You can just make out "<<print $confession2>>" on one of the cracked branches.

"It's ready."

She hands you a lighter. A purple bic.

"Let them go."

[[controlled burn]]

passages.name: gone Fangs 2
passages.text:
The alleyway, again. <<print $person1>>'s voice, close at your ear. The same words. The same red haze.

[[turn on them|turn on them 2]]
[[try to calm down again]]

passages.name: "I haven't been myself."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They snort<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She snorts<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He snorts<<endif>> indelicately into their own glass. "Well, obviously. You've been moody and quiet lately. It doesn't take a genius to know something's bothering you."

Rage courses through you. How dare <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he<<endif>> talk as if it's a problem like a lost job or a breakup? You're capable of being a monster.

You stand up abruptly. A bit of the bitter porter sloshes over the lip. "I need some air."

[[escape]]

passages.name: step in zombie
passages.text: It can't hurt more than this. Maybe you trust her. Maybe you're tired of the slow itch under your skin, the feeling of sinews stretched tight and wrong across impossible configurations of muscle and blood.\n\n[[submerge|submerge zombie]]

passages.name: yes ghost
passages.text:
"Real or not, you came to me. You wanted it to end. But you have choices. You've always had choices. Even when you've felt <<cyclinglink "lonely" "exhausted" "frightened" "miserable" "helpless" end>>. You came here for escape, not for death. If you'd wanted the latter you could have found it far easier." She shrugs. "Perhaps I'm wrong. But most of the ones like you don't know what they want. Or they do, but can't name it. Maybe you believe you're unworthy of it. Foolishness. That, if anything, shows you're human."

"So. Choices. I can give you what you've asked me for - or I can give you what you seek.

[[ask for death]]
[[ask for change]]

passages.name: make yourself new
passages.text: You could spend a lifetime unraveling the web. You [[will]].

passages.name: your mother
passages.text: She's reclining on a green plush sofa you don't recognize. She must have redecorated recently. One manicured hand holds her phone to her ear. She's talking, rapidly, more rapidly than you're used to. Her voice sounds <<cyclinglink $mother "concerned" "frustrated" "indifferent">>. She doesn't seem to notice your presence.\n\n[[listen|listen mother]]

passages.name: "How vast is it?"
passages.text: She just shakes her head. "Geometry isn't useful," is all she says. "Vast enough."\n\n[[okay|labyrinth end]]

passages.name: look
passages.text:
Something glints on the surface of the pond. Your reflection. It shifts.
You turn, alarmed, to the witch - 
only to see your own arms are outstretched, beseeching.
She nods towards the [[pond]].

passages.name: cleverness brutality
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[strength|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: Let them go
passages.text:
They're gone. Into ash and a dozen small specks of paper, scattered on the wind. Everything they've told you was your fault.

<<timedinsert 6s>>Your mistakes are yours, now, foolish but finite. They'll stop hurting someday.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 12s>>The crash of a branch brings you back. The tree is still [[burning|watch the tree blaze]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: mistakes bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[strength|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: will
passages.text: "I thought you might feel that way." Something that looks like triumph on her face.\n\nShe isn't the only one, though. You came here for something new, and you [[found|Turn back to the woods]] it.

passages.name: submerge zombie
passages.text:
The light is liquid in the spaces between your bones, slithering into hollows you'd long ago hoped would stop aching. It's a strange feeling, searing and intimate. You know something is changing, shifting back into place, but you cannot name it.

Perhaps that's a gift: after the exhaustive inventories of every different kind of pain, of mapping every loss and failure of your body, of learning every possible way to describe what's happened to you sand knowing not a one of them truly conveys the horror of it - you cannot name your transformation. It is between you and your skin.

You stay submerged in the water a long, long time.

<<timedinsert 15s>>Eventually, you're aware of the slippery feel of the water itself, cool against your <<if $lost eq "hands">>hands<<else if $lost eq "skin">>skin<<else if $lost eq "heart">>heart<<else if $lost eq "integrity">>chest<<endif>>. How long has it been since you felt sensation plainly, fully?

[[hhhh]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: your heart
passages.text: <<set $lost to "heart">>You imagine it still pumps blood through your body. You haven't felt it in a long time.\n\n[[...]]

passages.name: happened
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They offer<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She offers<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He offers<<endif>> you a grin, not as easy as it usually comes, and a nod to the bartender.

"Another for my friend here." You don't mind; you have similar taste in drinks.

"I didn't expect to see you out tonight. It's been a while."

[["I felt like a change."]]
[["It's been too long."]]
[["I didn't want to be alone."]]

passages.name: follow the green thread
passages.text: A thread that splits like a branch, every shoot new and flourishing.\nNew Years resolutions. Promises. Contracts, gym memberships, insincere plans to reconnect. You even meant some of them, once. They whisper of potential, and of loss. There are so [[many]].

passages.name: "I'm capable of terrible things."
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They laugh<<endif>>, but it doesn't sound particularly amused. "And I'm not? You don't know the half of it."

You rather think it's the other way around.

"Not the everyday cruelties and betrayals. We're not talking about infidelity or abuse."

<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She arches<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He arches<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They arch<<endif>> that brow at you again. "What, then?"

[["I've killed people."]]
[["I'm a monster."]]
[[lose your nerve]]

passages.name: twists
passages.text:
The glen, again. The shards of light still scattered. The gleam draws your eye. You can't help but glance. So much promise. So much more.

The witch looks satisfied. "There's so much in you that //could// happen; it seems terribly unfair to be satisfied with what //has// happened. You see that, now."

You find her difficult to [[focus]] on.

passages.name: nothing 2
passages.text:
You're back in the clearing, again. There are no more birds to startle with your screams.

The witch raises a brow. "Again."

[["Enough."|enough 2]]
[[go back|go back 2]]

passages.name: drips
passages.text:
You begin to see signs of life. Thick vines trailing fragrant white whispering flowers drape themselves over the metal branches. Squirrels chitter at each other in the unforgiving blue glare. Real trees - as far as you can tell in the neon pulse - begin to appear. The path is strewn with dry cracked wood, fragments of rusting metal, broken tubes.

By the time the path widens into open space, you can't see any of the architecture. The cathode glare has faded to a lambent glow. It looks like any other forest. But you know better. You've seen what's underneath.

Your way has widened into a clearing with [[a still pool of water]].

passages.name: your ex
passages.text: A living room you don't recognize. <<cyclinglink $exgender "He" "She" "They">> must have moved recently. You can just make out words.\n\n[[listen|listen ex]]

passages.name: in
passages.text: It's singing inside you, a new frequency. Your fingertips are glowing from within. This is a rough and wild magic. You can't control it; neither can the witch. You are both only conduits.\n\nThe light sparks up your nerves, races up your spine. You [[shiver]].

passages.name: timedgoto
agree willingly
passages.text:
The path you take is labyrinthine. Huge stones fallen across tangled roots, twists in the road, a brackish trickle of water in a creek bed. These are old-growth woods, untouched by fire but not by time.

The witch stumbles suddenly ahead of you. A rock's come loose.

[[look closer]]

passages.name: go back 2
passages.text:
The bar. The bitter glass. <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>Their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>Her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>His<<endif>> gentle concern. How many times are you going to have to look at <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>, knowing what you've done? <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He<<endif>> only wanted the best for you. You wish that were possible.

"Another for my friend here." You can taste the darkness in your throat already.

"I didn't expect to see you out tonight. It's been a while."

[["Mmm."]] There's no point.
[["I guess it has."]] No point at all.
[["I'm sorry."]] You can't change the past.

passages.name: go back 3
passages.text:
The bar, again. Your foe, predatory. Or so he imagines. He doesn't know what you are, can't fathom you're capable of anything more than the ordinary cruelties that make up a life. 

"Surprised you'd show your face here." 

Your fangs grind involuntarily. You can't help it, even now.

<<if $feeling eq "vindication">>[["You don't want to start this with me."]] You'd do it again, gladly.<<else if>>[["Are you sure you want to do this?"]]He seems so petty now.<<endif>>
[[walk away|walk away 3]] Break the cycle. Or try.

links.text: "You don't want to start this with me."

destination.name: "You don't want to start this with me."

links.text: "Are you sure you want to do this?"

destination.name: "Are you sure you want to do this?"

passages.name: gather some up
passages.text:
They smell faintly of amber and smoke.

<<set $has_hyacinths to 1>>

[[place them on the rock|your bounty]]

passages.name: try to calm down again
passages.text: Your blood pulses, an inexorable song. You cannot calm down.\n\n[[turn on them|turn on them 2]]

passages.name: approach directly
passages.text:
"Yeah, hi," <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he says<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she says<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they say<<endif>>, barely sparing you a second glance. <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>He turns<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>She turns<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>They turn<<endif>> back to a blond whose long-fingered hand covers a laughing mouth.

You lean forward, but you can't quite catch what <<if $newpersongender eq "him">>he's<<else if $newpersongender eq "her">>she's<<else if $newpersongender eq "them">>they're<<endif>> saying. Something about football?

[[laugh along]]
[[respond]]
[[wait for a different opening]]

passages.name: strength
passages.text:
You are capable of [[lying|lying strength]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|strength cleverness]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|mistakes strength]].
You are capable of [[candor|strength candor]].
You are capable of [[kindness|kindness strength]].

passages.name: pluck the blossoms
passages.text: The blossoms feel like silk and water under your hands. Soothing already.<<set $has_narcissus to 1>>\n\n[[place them on the rock|your bounty]]

passages.name: Yes 3
passages.text:
Absolution, or something like it. A detente with yourself.

A small smile plays at the witch's lips.

<<timedgoto "Turn back to the woods" 7s>>

passages.name: break
passages.text:
Cold night air. Crouched against the brick, you put your head between your knees, try to calm your breathing.

His voice shatters the relative calm.

"What's wrong?" Gloating, triumphant. "I couldn't have said anything //that// upsetting."

Of course he didn't. Of course not. It's always been you. Your reactions, your lack of control, your pain. It sings in the tensed space between tendon and bone. And then that thin thread [[snaps]] -

passages.name: "They told me where to find you."
passages.text:
"They often do." Her voice is dry. Almost amused: but not quite. She doesn't ask who "they" are. "I don't suppose //they// told you what seeking me out entails."

That <<cyclinglink "desperation" "exhaustion" "determination" "fear" "longing" "world-weariness" "desire" "pain" "loss" "guilt">> you'd felt earlier, that brought you here, comes crashing back down on you.

[[they didn't]]
[[they did, actually]]
[[you'd rather hear it from her]]

links.text: you'd rather hear it from her

destination.name: you'd rather hear it from her

passages.name: cleverness kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: get up
passages.text: <<if $location eq "a white-walled hospital room">>You try to sit up, but your movement is sluggish, drugged. The tubes poking through your skin restrict your movement. You should have remembered. But everything's been [[hazy]] lately.<<else if $location eq "your own bed">>You try - and then [[burrow]] back into the familiar sheets, your downy comforter that's swaddled you on cold nights. As if cocooning could bring back what you're missing. Or protect you from falling apart more.<<else if $location eq "an unfamiliar bedroom">>Someone sleeping beside you. Short hair ruffled against the pillow; body ensconced in the duvet. You have no idea who they are. Fuck. You run a hand over your face, try to sneak out of the bed without waking them. Your leg jostles against theirs, but they only bury their face further in the pillows. You still aren't sure who they are.\n\n[[find your clothes]]<<endif>>

passages.name: she's the only thing more frightening than you
passages.text:
She considers you a long moment. Her gaze on your skin crawls.

"Yes. I suppose that's true. Some might call you a monster, but I wouldn't. They say that about me, too. It's just a word people use when they can't or don't want to understand."

The witch offers you her hand. She doesn't seem afraid.

"Perhaps you'd better [[come]] with me."

passages.name: "I've done terrible things."
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They don't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She doesn't<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He doesn't<<endif>> know what to say to that, concealing <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>his<<endif>> hesitation with a sip of beer. Finally, <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they set their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she sets her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he sets his<<endif>> glass down. "Can you fix them?"

You weren't expecting that.

[["No."|confess]]

passages.name: thirdpassage
passages.text: You are capable of [[so much]].

passages.name: touch
passages.text: You reach forward. A kaleidoscope of grief, ecstasy, contempt, self-sacrifice. Uncountable emotions that slide from your grasp before you can even name them. The universe, laid bare.\n\n[[Closer]].

passages.name: resilience cleverness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[brutality|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: step between them
passages.text:
Almost without pause, you step forward, breaking the predator's smooth strike. The snake's fangs sink into your calf. Duller than you thought they'd be. So this is how it feels. The mouse skitters away into the undergrowth.

The witch looks at you. "Are you all right?"

[["I'm fine."]]
[["A bit shaken."]]
[["What just happened - "]]

passages.name: kindness
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|bravery kindness]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|cleverness kindness]].
You are capable of [[lying|lying kindness]].
You are capable of [[brutality|brutality kindness]].
You are capable of [[selfishness|mistakes kindness]].

passages.name: "You...remember?"
passages.text: "Time is different here."\n\n[[er]]

passages.name: "I'm fucking your brother."
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> eyes widen. "What the - " The knuckles gripping <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> glass go white. 

When <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she speaks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he speaks<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they speak<<endif>> next, it's coldly composed. "Well, I can't say I didn't expect it from //you//."

You'd expected anger, recriminations, obscenities, tears. But acceptance? The belief that you were always capable of something like that?

The red rage courses through you. You [[lunge]] -

passages.name: lose your nerve
passages.text:
Maybe it's not worth it. Maybe you just want a bit more time with <<print $vamplovergender>>. You smile, lopsided, and say nothing. It doesn't reach your eyes.

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's screaming, and you've been here before, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: "Enough."
passages.text:
"Are you sure? You'll never know if you could have resolved it. But if it's too much..."

[[you're sure]]
[[go back]]

Dwelling isn't going to help. Whatever it was, it's gone now. Like all the rest. <<if $location eq "a white-walled hospital room">>[[Lie back]]. Stop fighting the machines keeping you alive. They don't trust you to do it for yourself. Maybe they shouldn't.<<else>>Get out of there. [[Keep going]].<<endif>>

passages.name: Yes 2
passages.text:
She holds your gaze. "The truth. You need to say it."

[["I hurt them."]]
[["I hurt myself."]]
[["It didn't hurt enough."]]

passages.name: dark
passages.text:
You're back in the bar. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He offers<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They offer<<endif>> you a quirked smile - part invitation, part challenge - and and <<if $vamplovergender eq "they">>gesture<<else>>gestures<<endif>> to the bartender. You should have known it wouldn't be that easy.

"Hey. Let me get you a drink - whisky, right?"

[["Right."]] How much can you really change? It's only in your head.
[["Actually, I'd rather a beer."]] You want to see how much - if anything - you can affect.
[["Maybe just a glass of water."]] You'll try to keep a clear head. If that's even possible.

passages.name: cleverness bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[candor|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[mistakes|mistakes bravery]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|cleverness bravery]].
You are capable of [[lying|lying bravery]].
You are capable of [[brutality|brutality bravery]].
You are capable of [[kindness|kindness bravery]].

passages.name: brutality
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|brutality bravery]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|cleverness brutality]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|mistakes brutality]].
You are capable of [[candor|candor brutality]].
You are capable of [[kindness|brutality kindness]].

passages.name: (now what)
passages.text: You hear the echo of your own words in the clearing. Slowly, slowly, that empty space gapes open. What you splintered gnaws into your chest.\n\n[[keep breathing]]

passages.name: rustle
passages.text:
You bend down to investigate. It turns out to be a small hedgehog. His spines glow gold. (Wisdom and heart-comfort, if that's what you need.) He blinks at you warily.

[[pick him up]]
[[let him go]]

passages.name: until glen
passages.text:
You're back in the glen, her shock and grief still a lump in your throat. You blink at the sudden loss of unexpected intimacy. Your gut churns at the thought of being so close to someone else without their knowledge or consent.

"That isn't what you were expecting, I imagine."

[[nope]]

passages.name: "Annihilation is a siren song."
passages.text:
The witch laughs, an earthy, appealing sound. It echoes around the glen. Little slivers of light fall from the spread branches. "Many things are siren songs." She sounds fond.

"Desire. Knowledge. Power. And yet you've chosen your own annihilation."

She doesn't say anything else. You [[tramp]] silently together through the woods.

passages.name: "It's been a while."
passages.text:
"It has, hasn't it," she agrees, still smiling. "I haven't seen you out anywhere - not Sean's leaving drinks, or Katie's birthday."

You //were// at Katie's birthday. You don't remember the night well. You don't recall anyone you talked to, any meaningful conversations you had. You might as well not have been there.

[["I was at Katie's, actually. The fancy dress party?"]]

links.text: "I was at Katie's, actually. The fancy dress party?"

destination.name: "I was at Katie's, actually. The fancy dress party?"

passages.name: continue
passages.text:
In the commotion, and the aftermath, you've arrived at a small glen without realizing. Thick boughs droop gracefully towards the earth. The brackish eddy has swollen to a stream. The water is clear and pure and bubbling. There is a fairy pool by the shore, ringed by slippery rocks and cinnabar-red chanterelles. This is a place of magic.

You feel <<cyclinglink "uncomfortable" "unworthy" "suspicious" "renewed">>.

[[look to the witch]]
[[look to the pond]]

passages.name: brutality bravery
passages.text:
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[strength|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[lying|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: Capitulate
passages.text: You struggle to the shore, legs leaden. Every inch is another knife. Every dripping piece of flesh exposed to air sets your nerves trembling again. But you're out. You've done it.\n\nThe air bites into you. Your teeth are [[chattering]]. You'll never be warm again.

passages.name: timedreplace
"I'm sorry."
passages.text:
"For what?" There's nothing but concern in <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>his<<endif>> eyes; <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they lean<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she leans<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he leans<<endif>> forward to listen. For a moment, you imagine you could tell <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>> your secret, that <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they'd<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she'd<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he'd<<endif>> understand.

[["I've done terrible things."]] That's not a lie.
[["...I wish I'd been a better friend."]] That's not a lie, either.

links.text: "...I wish I'd been a better friend."

destination.name: "...I wish I'd been a better friend."

passages.name: escape
passages.text:
The alleyway is thankfully deserted. You take several deep, calming breaths of the cold night air. They're not enough.

"Hey, are you all right?"

It's too late. The rage has built; the red hunger has you in its grasp. You turn on <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>. The last thing you remember seeing is an awful look of recognition, and then [[nothing|nothing 2]] -

passages.name: but no
passages.text:
She's looking at you, curiously. "Are you all right? You seem - pale." You know.

"Maybe you should get a drink. I should, too. I can't think where Jamie's gone with my glass - "

With that, she <<if $flingadjective eq "pantherine grace">> springs <<else if $flingadjective eq "comfortable solidity">>heaves <<else if $flingadjective eq "sharp angles">>twists <<endif>> herself off the couch, that <<print $flingadjective>>shining through in every line of their body. You wish you were that present.

[[as always|as always 2]]

passages.name: No 3
passages.text:
Whatever you hoped for, this wasn't it.

She shrugs. "There are limits to my power. To all power. There is only so much I can offer you without giving up too much of myself. You might still find it, out there in the world."

[[okay|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: it's all you want
passages.text:
She sighs. "Suit yourself. But if that's //truly// what you want... " 

Her eyes glint. "You must agree to my methods. And my terms."

It's only fair, isn't it?

[["What are the terms?"]]

passages.name: too much
passages.text: The traces of light leaking from your palms drag you to the water. You aren't strong enough to resist. You don't lean towards the surface so much as [[collapse]] under the pull.

passages.name: untangle
passages.text:
So many infinite fragments of shining possibility. One, the green of new leaves, the promises you always wanted to keep. Dull storm grey, coiling, protecting itself. Gold, gleaming, the lie you've never been able to shake. The one you never wanted to.

You can almost see the pattern.

[[follow the green thread]]
[[follow the grey thread]]
[[follow the gold thread]]

passages.name: they didn't
passages.text: She laughs. "No one likes to. They don't want the responsibility."\n\n[[...|decision]]

passages.name: Interstitial wood gathering
passages.text:
<<once>>A small gap in the trees. A flat rock lies in the middle of the copse, covered in [[moss]]. Flowers, [[purple]] and [[white]], riot over a [[rotting]] log. There is a [[rustle]] in the undergrowth.

"I have a salve, but it won't be as effective without the right tonic. It's up to you to find what you need. If you come across something you think may help, place it on the rock, and I'll add it to the potion. You only get one, of course - anything more will disturb the balance."

It's a good thing you did your research before coming here. You thought there might be a test. It seems you weren't wrong.<<endonce>>

<<later>>A small gap in the trees. A flat rock lies in the middle of the copse, covered in [[moss]]. Flowers, [[purple]] and [[white]], riot over a [[rotting]] log. There is a [[rustle]] in the undergrowth.<<endlater>>

passages.name: mentor memory
passages.text: You hadn't known <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> felt that way about you. You had always [[looked up]] to <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>him<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>her<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>them<<endif>>; <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they'd<<endif>> given you [[good advice]]. You thought <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> [[cared]] about your success, valued your potential.\n\nYou swallow a lump in your [[throat|dissolve]].

passages.name: purple
passages.text:
Violets. A particular sort, found only in this forest. After a rain they swell with dew and cast pollen into the air that settles silver on the forest. They are said to bring renewal, healing, and to prevent minor kitchen injuries.

[[gather some up]]
[[maybe not|Interstitial wood gathering]]

passages.name: decision
passages.text:
"So. You must have been desperate to come to me." Yellow eyes peer out at you from the undergrowth. Quiet. Hungry. You aren't alone. "Before you tell me what you need: this is my forest. I obey its laws; it obeys mine."

"If you want my help: you'll agree to my bargains. Or you can walk away now, leave the woods unscathed. And unchanged." She smiles. Those sharp white teeth. As if she knows already. Knows how far you're prepared to go.

[[agree]] You're curious, or desperate.
[[decline]] Perhaps you don't trust witches' bargains.

passages.name: Safe
passages.text:
"Remember how you felt. It isn't always easy, when you leave the forest." She offers you a lopsided smile. "You'll forget, of course. They always do. But something might linger. Let it."

[[let it]]
[[deny it]]

passages.name: widdershins
passages.text: //Widdershins//. You nodded authoritatively when they said the word, and looked it up after in the privacy of your apartment. Why don't they just [[say|wait start]] counter-clockwise? \n\nWitches.

passages.name: "I felt like a change."
passages.text:
"Well, good for you." 

The bartender slides a pint towards you. You take an experimental sip: a dark porter, a bitter bite. It's not to your taste, but you can't exactly refuse a memory.

<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They raise their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She raises her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He raises his<<endif>> own glass to you. "Cheers, then. To changing."

[["To changing."]]

passages.name: go in for a hug
passages.text:
<<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They tense<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She tenses<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He tenses<<endif>> infinitesimally as you reach out to <<print $ghostgender1>>, as if your touch carries a chill. <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>Their<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>Her<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>His<<endif>> hands come up awkwardly, search for purchase on your back, find none. 

They slide off; <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>they jam<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>she jams<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>he jams<<endif>> them into the back pockets of their jeans. You're left craving touch more than you were before you tried. The silence stretches out. You've got to say something.

[["Well...hi!"]]
[["How have you been?"]]

passages.name: "It was different this time."
passages.text: "I can see that. It will be curious to see what effect you've had on the water."\n\n[[try again|Try again 2]]

passages.name: run
passages.text:
You come back to yourself, by the side of the pond. You are sweating freely. Drops of perspiration fall into the water and mingle with the stream.

"Well, that's new."

[["It was different this time."]]

passages.name: Look
passages.text:
As you gaze, your face begins to shudder, to ripple outwards. Fissures in your flesh crack open to reveal a dark stillness beneath. It's the pond. The pond. Not what's seething beneath your skin. Breathe.

<<timedinsert 3s>>The tremors radiate outwards, in perfect small circles. You realize you are crying.

[[look away|Look away]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: inspect
passages.text:
the roar of jet engines crushing towards a center point of light - 

a structure of glass, crystalline honeycombs of light blazing. layer on layer of impossible geometries. it calls you.

[[smash through the layers]]
[[peel back the light]]
[[resonate with the frequency]]

passages.name: so much
passages.text: Your silhouette pulses with light. You still see your face, familiar, in the blazing corona, but it's different now. Or perhaps you're finally seeing it right.\n\nIt won't be perfect. You won't be perfect. You're complicated, messy, human. Others will still outshine you, ignore you, leave you. Love you less than you wish. But you won't disappear. You [[know|life]] that now.

passages.name: go back
passages.text:
The bar. The glass. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> smile. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>Her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>His<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>Their<<endif>> hands. How many times are you going to have to look at <<print $vamplovergender>>, knowing what you've done? You could have loved <<print $vamplovergender>>. You know that now.

"Hey. Let me get you a drink - whisky, right?" Still <<print $voice>>.

[["Sure."]] There's no point.
[["Not thirsty."]] No point at all.
[["I love you."]] You can't change the past.

passages.name: "I think I'll pass."
passages.text:
"Really? Well that's too bad. Another time, then?" There's hurt in <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> eyes. You swallow guilt. <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He'd<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They'd<<endif>> be hurt worse, if you stuck around.

(<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She //was//<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He //was//<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They //were//<<endif>> hurt worse.)

"Sure. See you around."

You turn on your heel and walk out, into the alley behind the bar, exhaling a shaky breath as you pass through the worn steel door. You did it. You did it. You didn't hurt <<print $vamplovergender>>.

Relief and the red hunger course through you in equal measure. You give yourself over to it, finally, ravening your own flesh, sacrificing yourself in their place. Blood slicks your torso, your arms, your thighs. The world goes [[dark]].

passages.name: "Finished what?"
passages.text: "You're not bound to your body any longer. Your choices. Your memories." She gestures to the pond. "Go and see."\n\n[[come and see]]

passages.name: "I can't."
passages.text:
"You have to. It's the only way. Sometimes there's a choice - but not here. That's why there are stories about creatures like us - the monster and the witch. I'm sorry."

You nod. There doesn't seem to be anything else to say. You step back to the edge of the pond. You place both hands flat on the surface, so the light-lines meet their mirrors and converge. If they can.

A flash, and then you're [[gone|gone Fangs 2]].

passages.name: ok
passages.text: The traces of light leaking from your palms drag you to the water. You aren't strong enough to resist. You don't lean towards the surface so much as [[collapse]] under the pull.

passages.name: the slightest sheen
passages.text: A luminescent wisp, almost lost in the dark water. You reach out to try to [[grasp]] it -\n

passages.name: Lavender
passages.text: A sympathetic look. "My, you //are// in pain. I'll do my best for you." Somehow, that's not entirely comforting.\n\nShe tucks your offering into her shapeless - dress? cloak? you aren't sure. It rustles around her feet as the relentless chirp of crickets reaches a fevered height. She pays no heed, only continues [[on|on start]].

passages.name: clearing 3
passages.text:
You're back in the clearing, again. There are no more birds to startle with your screams.

The witch raises a brow. "How did it feel?"

That <<print $feeling>> crashes in on you. You can't speak.

"You'll have to feel it again." Her smile is not kind. "You're lucky. That's what most people want, or think they do, when they imagine vengeance. And now you have the chance. Lucky you."

[["Enough."|enough 3]]
[[go back|go back 3]]

passages.name: clearing 2
passages.text:
You're alone, except for the witch. You try to recall how <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth felt under yours, but even that's vanished. 

Your lips press together; your canines slice through flesh. Blood in your mouth, drowning the memory of <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> taste.

Only a memory. 

[[still]], just for one moment -
[[not enough]]

passages.name: Protest
passages.text:
She listens to your objections, and shrugs. "That's why you came to me. But it's your choice. It's always been your choice. You can walk away without it. But this is the price."

The thing looks at you reproachfully.

[[surrender|Accept]]
[[walk away|Walk away]]

passages.name: spins
passages.text:
Back in the glen, catching your breath, hands still held out in front of you as if you could still grasp the threads.

You must look aghast at the loss, because the witch tsks irritably at you. "They're not //gone//. You haven't even lost the ability to //see// them. But you can't do it for too long here; this is a place of power. Potentials shift and crumble like sand here. It's safer to practice outside the forest."

That makes sense.

[["Okay."]]

passages.name: "Just keeping you on your toes."
passages.text: "There are easier ways to keep me on my toes." But <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they lean<<endif>> in for a kiss. Relief and pleasure flood your veins, almost drowning out the clamoring hunger. You know it won't last. You know it's not real. But you're thankful for the moment anyway.\n\n<<timedinsert 4s>>Too quickly, it's over. The moment slips through your grasp. You're back in the [[clearing|clearing 2]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: Yes.
passages.text: She nods. "Trying is all you can do. You'll fail, you know. We all do, sometimes. But that's all right. They'll grow back anyways."\n\n[[maybe|Turn back to the woods]]

passages.name: "For how long?"
passages.text: She shakes her head. "I don't know. Everyone's different. It ought to last. If it doesn't - " She doesn't say more. She doesn't have to.\n\nFor now, you can still feel the effects. The night air sends a comforting chill through your skin, your hands, your beating heart. You [[breathe it in|CREDITS]].

passages.name: No
passages.text: The witch watches you, impassively. She is patient. She will wait as long as she needs.\n[[fine|Look]]

passages.name: "I was at Katie's, actually. The fancy dress party?"
passages.text:
