"Oh!" She looks vaguely guilty. "I wish I'd seen you - it would have been nice to catch up." She doesn't meet your eyes.

"I ought to go see where Jaime's gone to with my drink. But I'll see you around?"

With that, she <<if $flingadjective eq "pantherine grace">> springs <<else if $flingadjective eq "comfortable solidity">>heaves <<else if $flingadjective eq "sharp angles">>twists <<endif>> herself off the couch, that <<print $flingadjective>> shining through in every line of her body. 

She always had an energy: that's what drew you to her, that weekend away. That vitality singing through her blood. You thought perhaps you might -

[[but no|as always 2]].

passages.name: Is this really what you wanted?
passages.text: Well. You know how to [[find your way back]] if you change your mind. Until then, the path [[out|CREDITS]] is easy to find.

passages.name: down
passages.text:
You're back in the glen, your body still singing with light. Your heartbeat pulses a rhythm that still resonates with that frequency. The music - if it is music - is part of you now.

"That's what that sort of magic does." Her mouth curves up. Recognition. "It's larger than your own body. Still, if you'd been looking for escape, you might find..."

You're barely listening. All you want to do is let it pour out of you. All that [[light|Turn back to the woods]].

passages.name: candor brutality
passages.text:
You are capable of [[integrity|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: "Mmm."
passages.text: You barely respond to the toast; drink in near-silence. When you can stand it no longer, you drop several bills on the counter without looking at <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>, and head straight for the alley.\n\nYour friend doesn't follow. You're [[alone]] in the night air.

passages.name: your
passages.text: Fangs grind into teeth. Your mouth fills with the tang of your own blood. You choke it down.\n\nYou mumble your excuses through a closed mouth, so he doesn't see the red stains, and [[vanish|break 2]]. Does it feel any better?

passages.name: looked up
passages.text: <<print $mentorgender>> voice was strong and authoritative; <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they<<endif>> had a way of commanding a room. You wished you had that sort of power, that kind of raw charisma that would make everyone listen to your ideas.\n\n<<if $mentorgender eq "His">>He<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>She<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>They<<endif>> said <<if $mentorgender eq "His">>he'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Her">>she'd<<else if $mentorgender eq "Their">>they'd<<endif>> [[teach|mentor memory]] you.

passages.name: If only
passages.text:
But they're gone, aren't they?

<<timedinsert 3s>>They can't hurt you anymore.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>The crash of a branch brings you back. The tree is still [[burning|watch the tree blaze]].<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: "Did it work?"
passages.text:
She laughs, but there's no humor in it. "I'm here, aren't I?"

That doesn't seem to be an answer.

"Try again." It isn't a suggestion.

[["All right."]]

passages.name: your hands
passages.text: <<set $lost to "hands">>You can't trust them anymore. They don't obey you, get you into trouble. They shake too much; at the wrong times.\n\n[[...]]

passages.name: your mentor
passages.text: <<cyclinglink $mentorgender "His" "Her" "Their">> office. The leather desk chair turned away from you. You can just make out words.\n\n[[listen|listen mentor]]

passages.name: a man with a clenched jaw
passages.text:
<<set $face to "man">>Rage pulses in his chest. A muscle jumps in his cheek. He tries to bite back his words. He doesn't want to hurt his lover, even though Jack hasn't shown //him// the same consideration.

"You can't treat me that way, as if my feelings are a joke." His words stick in your throat. That's so much kinder than what you - than what //he// - wanted to say.

You swallow someone else's sense of futility and [[loss|until rage]].

passages.name: fork
passages.text: She turns right, scrambles over a fallen log, surprisingly spry for a woman who carries a walking stick. You scramble to [[keep up|Right]].

passages.name: it's something you haven't tried yet
passages.text:
She smirks. "Is //that// all." It didn't seem so simple to you. "Well, I'm sure I can find something else you haven't tried." It sounds like a challenge.

[["Like what?"]]
[[it's all you want]]

passages.name: your own possibilities
passages.text: You can't bring yourself to do that to another person. Or maybe you're curious about what lies [[inside you]].

passages.name: next 2
passages.text:
<<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>They offer<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>She offers<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>He offers<<endif>> you a grin, not as easy as it usually comes, and a nod to the bartender.

"Another for my friend here." You don't mind; you have similar taste in drinks.

"I didn't expect to see you out tonight. It's been a while."

[["I felt like a change."]]
[["It's been too long."]]
[["I didn't want to be alone."]]

passages.name: not that kind of monster
passages.text:
<<set $monster to "werewolf">>You don't feed. Not in that way, at least. It's just the rage inside of you, so thick it chokes, more a part of you than yourself. Just the rage. "Just".

The body is cooling.

[[cover it with something]]
[[flee]]

passages.name: ask for change
passages.text: "Good. Brave, at least. That's more important."\n\nShe extends one [[hand|accept]] to you, palm upward.

passages.name: a still pool of water
passages.text:
The clearing is choked with hawthorn bushes and brambles, bare trees, their knotted branches shining under the full moon, and a vast pond, still and quiet. The moonlight shimmers on the water, smooth as glass and bright as hate. You would see yourself as you are, if you looked in.

[[look|Look]]
[[no|No]]

passages.name: listen mother
passages.text:
You can only hear fragments of her conversation.

"I haven't, no, not in ages. I keep meaning to call, but - " <<if $mother eq "concerned">>"I don't know how to reach - "<<else if $mother eq "frustrated">>"I'm just so exasperated; it's like talking to a brick wall - "<<else if $mother eq "indifferent">>"I'd know if I were needed, don't you think?"<<endif>>

She sighs. "It isn't natural, for a child to ignore their mother."

You wince. There's a sense of relief when the scene you've just witnessed starts to run at the edges and [[dissolve|mother memory]] -

passages.name: Say it
passages.text:
"Absolution."

It hangs in the air. You feel flayed to the bone. The eyes roam over you, your naked weakness. You realize that your hands are trembling.

She nods, once. "That will do."

[[into the wood]]

passages.name: "Maybe just a glass of water."
passages.text:
"Sure thing, kid. Bad hangover?"

"I feel like death." No trace of a smile on your face, but <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she grins<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he grins<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they grin<<endif>> at you anyway, that rakish smile.

"Well you sure don't look like one."

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's [[screaming]] -

passages.name: step from the stream
passages.text:
Naked and whole and vulnerable, you emerge from the water. Dripping. Glistening in the moonlight. Your own blood thrums in your ears. Your darting heart pulses beneath your breastbone.  

You make short work of dressing, shivering as you are. When you're done, the witch looks to you.

"It seems to have worked."

[[nod]]
[[you're not sure|shake yr head]]
[["For how long?"]]

passages.name: um
passages.text:
"You came to me for absolution. You wanted it to hurt more."

Her eyes are sharp.

"You're going to set the fire. You're going to watch it burn. Something new will come of this."

She presses something into your hand. A <<continue>>pen.<<endcontinue>>pen. An ordinary ballpoint pen you can find at the drugstore. And a sheet of loose [[paper]].

passages.name: CREDITS
passages.text:
Crossroads was written and coded by Cat Manning in [[Twine|http://twinery.org/]], with additional code by [[Leon Arnott|http://l.j-factor.com/]] 

Beta-tested by A.M. Guay, Talitha, Rick Baer, and Celia Martel. 

The title image is [[Deep in the forest, Christmas Eve|https://www.flickr.com/photos/movito/2214551923/]] by Flickr user [[Fredrik Matheson|https://www.flickr.com/photos/movito/]] and is used under Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

passages.name: uh
passages.text: "[[Look harder]]. Tell me what you really see."

passages.name: "What would I need to do to convince  you?"
passages.text:
<<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They laugh<<endif>>, audible even over the thumping bass. "Show me."

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's screaming, and you've been here before, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: grasp
passages.text:
You're at a party, crammed into someone's chic split-level walkup. Bright EDM pulses a communal heartbeat through the mass of bodies, smiling, laughing, drinking, pressing up against each other. No one smiles at you, offers you a drink, presses up against you. You might as well be invisible.

Then, across the room, you catch someone's eye.

[[A friend.]] You haven't seen <<cyclinglink $ghostgender1 "them" "her" "him">> in ages.
[[An old fling.]] It might be nice to catch up.
[[Someone new.]] You don't know them, but you'd like to.

passages.name: agree
passages.text:
"Good." Almost a purr. "What have you brought me, as an offering?"

[[Lavender]]. For renewal, and peace.
[[Bay]]. For protection, and strength.
[[Wormwood]]. Poison. She'll know how to use it.

passages.name: "I guess it has."
passages.text: Your friend's queries are met with the barest of responses. As the evening wears on, rejection and hurt begins to flash in <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>his<<endif>> eyes. When you can stand it no longer, you drop several bills on the counter without looking at <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>them<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>him<<endif>>, and head straight for the alley.\n\nYour friend doesn't follow. You're [[alone]] in the night air.

passages.name: You feel empty
passages.text: Knowing yourself has drained you. There's something you've lost. Scooped out. Hollow. You don't know what it is. You don't know if you'll miss it. But your breathing is easier.\n\n[[(now what)]]

passages.name: Watch the water
passages.text:
Your reflection, shimmering on the water. Look at yourself.

Your <<cyclinglink "brown" "green" "blue" "black" "hazel" "grey" "dead">> eyes look back.

Has it always been so difficult to meet your own gaze?

<<timedinsert 15s>><<timedreplace 10s>>Fight the urge to look away. She gave you the task.<<becomes>>Anatomize your face. Take yourself apart. Brows. Lips. Nose. Cheekbones. Chin. The curve of your jaw. The guilt in your eyes. <<becomes>>As you focus on one feature, the rest slip your gaze, turn hazy and indistinct. You can't hold on to yourself.<<becomes>>Breathe. Breathe.<<becomes>>It's you. Just you.<<endtimedreplace>><<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 65s>>...of course, that's the problem, isn't it?<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 65s>>It's always only been you.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 65s>>Just you, and what you've done.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 75s>>Nearly unbearable, now.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "Breathe" 85s>>

passages.name: vampenemyfine
passages.text:
"You don't sound fine." His voice drips with feigned concern. 

You don't have the patience for this. It's already gnawing at you, blurring your resistance to a soft haze. As much as you might want to sink your teeth into his supple neck, tear that fragile vein until it gouts hot blood over your face and his, close at last -

No. You push past him, the feel of his body against yours only making the hunger clamor louder. The dance floor is a potential slaughter. You [[break]] for the freedom of the alley -

passages.name: do nothing
passages.text:
You do nothing. It isn't your affair. The snake lunges forward, one fluid brutal motion. It's over in seconds.

The witch looks at you. "Are you all right?"

[["I'm fine."]]
[["A bit shaken."]]
[["What just happened - "]]

passages.name: strength candor
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[cleverness|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[resilience|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[mistakes|thirdpassage]].
You are capable of [[kindness|thirdpassage]].

passages.name: they did, actually
passages.text: You start to speak, but she waves her hand, and you fall silent. It probably isn't a spell. "It doesn't matter." Her eyes are sharp and dark as they look you over. "The stories about me are rarely true."\n\n[[...|decision]]

passages.name: "Maybe you're right."
passages.text: "I'm not entirely sure I am, though. Death is a puzzle: universal, unknowable, ineluctable. I'm not sure we can categorize it definitively. Other experiences, certainly." She flashes you a predatory smile. "You'll experience that soon enough."\n\nYou keep [[walking|to the location]] in silence, only broken by the occasional snap of a twig.

passages.name: smash through the layers
passages.text: You clench a fist and swing. The light fractures. Fractal patterns bloom in the wreckage. Faces, some you know and some you've never seen before, shimmer in them. Infinite possibilities, emotions, stories. They're close enough to [[touch]].

passages.name: shines
passages.text:
You are capable of [[bravery]].
You are capable of [[cleverness]].
You are capable of [[strength]].
You are capable of [[brutality]].
You are capable of [[kindness]].

passages.name: try to breathe
passages.text:
<<cyclinglink "In." "Out." "In." "Out.">>

<<timedinsert 10s>>As you breathe, you watch. The roots have begun to nestle deeper. Pale green shoots poke hesitantly through the wreckage.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "she looks at you" 15s>>

passages.name: "Yeah."
passages.text:
The silence stretches. 

<<timedinsert 5s>>"You're looking - well," she offers. As if she doesn't notice the dark circles. The dullness of your hair. How your skin's shrinking back from your brittle nails.

[["So are you."]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: "Whatever you say."
passages.text:
Maybe it's not worth it. Maybe you just want a bit more time with <<print $vamplovergender>>. You smile, lopsided, and say nothing. It doesn't reach your eyes.

And then <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> mouth is covering yours, hot and insistent and burning and you shouldn't, you're in public, and oh -

and then //oh// - 

It takes over, and you bite down, hard, on <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>her<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>his<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>their<<endif>> lip. Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can do more than yelp in surprise your mouth is on <<print $vamplovergender>>, and there's screaming, and you've been here before, and then [[nothing]] -

passages.name: A friend.
passages.text:
You're glad to see <<print $ghostgender1>>, jeans and a white t-shirt glowing slighly in the low light. You hurry to <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>their<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>her<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>his<<endif>> side. Though the living room is full, bodies part to make space for you without noticing your presence, without brushing up against you or nodding. Your skin aches for contact.

"Hey," you say. Your voice is too soft to be heard over the music.

[["HEY."]]
[[raise a hand in greeting]]
[[go in for a hug]]

passages.name: no
passages.text:
"One doesn't always." Her voice is dry. "But if you keep hurting and don't learn, you'll be more wound than whole. Come on, I'll patch you up. This time."

She starts off towards the wood, leaning on her stick. She is in no hurry.

[[Follow|Interstitial wood gathering]]

passages.name: look to the pond
passages.text:
The mushrooms cluster on the shore, as if they grew in riot towards the water. Of course, that's ridiculous; mushrooms don't need water. And yet you can't shake the thought.

The surface of the pond seems almost undisturbed by the currents that carry leaves and twigs further downstream, away from the glen. You can just make out the barest hint of your reflection and the witch's, just on the edge of the water, from where you're standing.

[[look to the witch]]

passages.name: burrow
passages.text:
Hnngh. You can't face another loss. You take remorseless inventory of all your failings. What's wrong now?

[[your heart]]
[[your hands]]
[[your skin]]
[[your integrity]]

passages.name: "I'm fine."
passages.text: "Good. Don't trouble yourself. It's the way of the forest. Cyclical. Predator and prey. Of course, your case is more - complicated." She purses her lips delicately.\n\nYou're not sure how you want to respond to that statement. Or to the look on her face. You [[continue]] in silence.

passages.name: "Fuck off."
passages.text: Smug, condescending, lying bastard. But you can't prove it. Even though every word drips with detached contempt. He plays the game well. You're trapped. The monster [[stirs]].

passages.name: "Like what?"
passages.text:
"A ritual. My own devising." The witch shakes her head, her close-cropped curls an eerie corona in the moonlight. "If it really is death itself you sought when you came here, and not just the boundaries of experience - well. That's my bargain. Take it or leave it. I won't say more."

[[Agree]] You're curious, or you want it enough.
[[Decline]] You're distrustful, or stubborn.

passages.name: gone 2
passages.text:
The alleyway, again. Their voice, close at your ear. The same words. The same red haze.

[[try to calm down|try to calm down 2]]
[[tell them to run]]

passages.name: follow the gold thread
passages.text:
It coalesces into a soft sphere of pulsing gold. If you could only grasp it, you might be able to hold it, safe and whole and cherished.

[[grasp for it]]
[[that's not what light does]]

passages.name: walk away 3
passages.text: The hunger is still gnawing at you, blurring your resistance to that familiar haze. You still want to sink your teeth into his supple neck, tear that fragile vein until it gouts hot blood over your face and his, close at last -\n\nNo. You push past him, the feel of his body against yours making the hunger clamor louder. The dance floor is a still slaughter. It always will be. You [[break|break 2]] for the freedom of the alley, again, as you always do in your nightmares -

passages.name: "All right."
passages.text: You step back to the edge of the pond. This time, you're prepared. You place both hands flat on the surface, so the light-lines meet their mirrors and converge. If they can.\n\nA flash, and then you're [[gone|gone Fangs 2]].

passages.name: Keep going
passages.text: Dressed, you step out into the street. The insistent blare of traffic. The crush of crowds. Your senses are overwhelmed. Once there would have been a barrier, protecting you from the outside world, but that's been worn away as well. You grit your teeth and [[hurry on]].

passages.name: stay
passages.text:
"You'll have to learn to live with yourself. But it's a good exercise; mapping yourself onto the passages." She sounds intimately familiar with the concept. 

"There may be a time when I introduce another like you into the maze. Like I said, you're not the first I've seen. If that happens, you two will have to learn to live with each other. Or resolve things...otherwise."

It doesn't sound so bad, learning another monster. Another reflection of yourself.

She leans on her staff, starts - presumably - in the direction of the [[labyrinth]].

passages.name: Endure
passages.text: It hurts. But this is what you need. Pain blooms on your skin. In your heart. [[Bear it]], as long as you can.

passages.name: as always
passages.text:
You're in the grove again. Does it matter?

You're insubstantial, even in your memories. You can't change anything, or make an impression, even in your own head.

"You have to try," the witch offers. "You have to make an effort."

[[ok]]
[[too much]]

passages.name: "Not thirsty."
passages.text: Before <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they<<endif>> can protest, you offer <<print $vamplovergender>> a sad smile, push past <<print $vamplovergender>>, heading across the dance floor. Sweat-slick bodies twine together, come apart, as if the rhythm of intimacy and loss can be learned and practiced. No one touches you. For the best.\n\nYou [[push|alley 2]] through the crush into the alley -

passages.name: let it
passages.text: The memory of the cold lingers in your marrow. Your teeth ache. You know what you've done. You can [[live with it|Turn back to the woods]] now. You'll have to.

passages.name: face the cold
passages.text: The witch shrugs. "Suit yourself. If you want to suffer more, that's your choice."\nThe chill bites your skin. You feel alive. Seared. [[Clean|Safe]].

passages.name: follow the threads
passages.text: Infinite lives. Infinite lies, self-deceptions, crafted by small scared creatures coiling in on themselves. \n\nYou won't change that much in a new body. But perhaps you hunger that much for something new. Or perhaps you're that desperate to get out of your own skin. Your fingers [[itch|will]] to trace a new pattern already.

passages.name: hurry on
passages.text: They look you over, passersby and shop clerks and pedestrians, sneaking glances when they think you aren't looking. As if you don't know. As if you're not used to being stripped bare by curious strangers.\n\nYou're [[rotting|rotting 2]]. Falling apart in plain sight.

passages.name: rotting
passages.text:
In the cracked detritus of the blasted log, there is a ring of fairy toadstools. Warding off the evil eye. Strength through pain.

[[What you've been looking for]]
[[Maybe not|Interstitial wood gathering]]

passages.name: "A bit shaken."
passages.text: "Understandable. Life will prevail, but it isn't always pleasant, or easy. Watching or participating." Her smile is grim. "Of course, you know this."\n\nYou're not sure how you want to respond to that statement. Or to the look on her face. The pair of you [[continue]] in silence.

passages.name: Untitled Stylesheet 1
Untitled Stylesheet 2
Untitled Stylesheet 3
"HEY."
passages.text:
You raise your voice until you're nearly shouting. <<if $ghostgender1 eq "them">>They look<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "her">>She looks<<else if $ghostgender1 eq "him">>He looks<<endif>> surprised to see you.

"Oh, hey. I didn't see you there." Disappointment, sharp at the back of your throat. Then who did they see when they looked at you?

[["Oh."]]
[["Well...hi!"]]
[["How have you been?"]]

passages.name: "I had to say it."
passages.text:
There's an urgency in your voice. You'll never get another chance.

A long pause. And then - 

<<timedinsert 3s>>"I'm glad you did." <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They lean<<endif>>
in for a kiss. Relief and pleasure flood your veins, almost drowning out the clamoring hunger. You know it won't last. You know it's not real. But you're thankful for the moment anyway.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 6s>>Too quickly, it's over. The moment slips through your grasp. You're back in the [[clearing|clearing 2]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: weekends away
passages.text: Just the two of you in <<if $exgender eq "He">>his<<else if $exgender eq "She">>her<<else if $exgender eq "They">>their<<endif>> old Ford Focus, your feet up on the dashboard, playfully arguing (at least, you thought so at the time) over the GPS [[directions|ex memory]].

passages.name: "Maybe."
passages.text: <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>She laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>He laughs<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>They laugh<<endif>> at your enigmatic answer, but <<if $vamplovergender eq "her">>she still leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "him">>he still leans<<else if $vamplovergender eq "them">>they still lean<<endif>> in for a kiss. Relief and pleasure flood your veins, almost drowning out the clamoring hunger. You know it won't last. You know it's not real. But you're thankful for the respite anyway.\n\n<<timedinsert 4s>>Too quickly, it's over. The moment slips through your grasp. You're back in the [[clearing|clearing 2]] - <<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: "To changing."
passages.text:
Your discomfort must show in your face, because <<if $vampfriendgender eq "They">>they frown and set their<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "She">>she frowns and sets her<<else if $vampfriendgender eq "He">>he frowns and sets his<<endif>>  own glass down without drinking. Bad luck, you think distantly.

"What's wrong? You've been acting weird lately."

[["I haven't been myself."]]
[["I'm not happy with my life."]]
[["Nothing's wrong."]]
